description: Baseballs winter meetings are all about the future  players changing teams, leagues changing rules  except for the first order of business. On Sunday night in San Diego, a committee of executives, historians and former players will announce its verdict on the 10 candidates it is considering for the Hall of Fame.

title: Frances Weekend of Discontent: Yellow Vest and Pension Protesters Gather
description: PARIS  One protest movement started a year ago in France and drew hundreds of thousands at its peak to roundabouts across the country in angry Yellow Vest demonstrations against planned increases in gas taxes.

title: Our 50 Most Popular Recipes of 2019
description: This weekend, cook our most popular recipe this year, Alison Romans vinegar chicken with crushed olive dressing (above), or make Huli Huli chicken, Via Carotas Insalata Verde or any of the recipes in the collection below.

title: The Man Who Predicted Nazi Germany
description: On Dec. 8, 1919, Macmillan Press published a book by a relatively obscure British Treasury official who had resigned from the government in protest over the Versailles treaty that brought the epochal trauma of the First World War to its conclusion.

title: Is It Possible Trump Is on the Right Track With China?
description: Trumps trade war is losing, not gaining, support, Paul Krugman wrote this week in his column Why Is Trump a Tariff Man? So why does the president avoid making the deals that might end this perpetual state of economic uncertainty? In a word, freedom.

title: Violence Drives a Swell in Mexican Migration
description: CIUDAD JUREZ, Mexico  A crackdown on illegal immigration has sharply curbed the number of Central Americans and others trying to enter the United States. But Mexicans, who have not been bound by some of the same restrictions, have been showing up at the border in greater numbers, in many cases fleeing the escalating violence in their country.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: ACROSTIC  Theres no correlation between hard-to-solve acrostics and esoteric themes, is there? Im sure we all have strong and weak subjects, and Im also pretty sure that the chances of any passage being familiar (as in, already read) by the average solver are pretty slim. Today, I think the subject matter of the passage is quite heady and thought-provoking, and I also think that a lot of the clues, many of which related to the theme as per usual, are really hard.

title: Judiciary Committee Report Offers Legal Rationale for Impeaching Trump
description: WASHINGTON  House Democrats released a report on Saturday intended to lay out the legal and historical underpinnings of their case for impeaching President Trump while also countering Republican accusations that the investigation of the presidents conduct in office has been unfair and illegitimate.

title: These Baby Names Defined the 2010s
description: The 2010s gave us new trends in baby naming, which Pamela Redmond of Nameberry has analyzed for a new piece on our site. Apparently, Freya and Theo seem destined to fill nurseries for years to come, Pamela wrote. In another look at the past decade, Kathryn Jezer-Morton asked, Did moms exist before social media? The literal answer is yes, of course, but the rise of social media has changed how we parent and how we talk about parenting.

title: The Loss of Mom-and-Pop Stores That Cant Compete With Amazon
description: To the Editor:

title: Trump Wants a Review of Toilets: Americans Are Flushing 10 Times, 15 Times
description: President Trump is taking on Americans flushing habits and the countrys water efficiency standards.

title: Two New Drugs Help Relieve Sickle-Cell Disease. But Who Will Pay?
description: The Food and Drug Administration recently approved two transformative new treatments for sickle-cell disease, the first in 20 years. But the drugs are wildly expensive, renewing troubling questions about access to cutting-edge medicines.

title: Behind the Scenes of Impeachment: Crammed Offices, Late Nights, Cold Pizza
description: WASHINGTON  Far from any television camera and a half world away from Ukraine, a few dozen Democratic staff aides, lawyers and House members are grinding away this weekend in a loose clump of Capitol Hill offices, the beating heart of the impeachment operation against President Trump.

title: Is Natural Wine Dead?
description: By now pretty much everyone on earth, save for those caught in a Yellow Tail time warp, has heard of natural wine. Made from organically grown grapes, with nothing added or taken away, these wines are no passing fad. They are a return to authenticity.

title: Katie Hill: Its Not Over After All
description: On Nov. 6, 2018, I was elected to Congress; at 31, I was one of the youngest women ever elected to the House of Representatives. One year later, I was sitting on a train to New York to meet with my lawyers about suing The Daily Mail for cyber exploitation  and I was no longer a member of Congress.

title: Where the Frauds Are All Legal
description: Much of what we accept as legal in medical billing would be regarded as fraud in any other sector.

title: Hating the Word Hate
description: WASHINGTON  When people ask me about my work, or comment on it, there is one word that always makes me bristle.

title: The Four Secrets of Success
description: Whenever I visit a university, students ask for Big Advice. I protest that I dont have great secrets for life and that my own path has been serendipitous, but they suspect me of holding out.

title: Democrats Baffling 2020 Mess
description: Kamala Harris folded her tent, and on that patch of ground, many flimsy theories bloomed.

title: Exhausted With the Experts
description: In last Sundays column, I argued that Democrats looking for someone to unify their fractious coalition should take another glance at Bernie Sanders  on the grounds that hes more popular across the partys different factions, more unifying, more exciting and more potentially appealing to non-liberals than his critics tend to assume.

title: Jim Brown: Football Has Forgotten the Men Who Made It Great
description: Turn on any N.F.L. game on Sunday, and youll see the league celebrating its 100th season. Thunderous video montages and Top 10 Tight Ends specials will exalt footballs history with one clear, though unspoken, message: The appeal and profitability of todays N.F.L. derives as much from its past as its present.

title: The World Solved the Ozone Problem. It Can Solve Climate Change.
description: Nearly 50 years ago, three chemists named Mario Molina, Sherwood Rowland and Paul Crutzen found evidence that chlorofluorocarbons, chemicals known as CFCs and released from aerosol sprays, were weakening the ozone layer that functions as the earths natural sunscreen protecting humans, animals and plants from harmful radiation.

title: Hypnosis Changed My Life
description: It had been nearly a week, and I hadnt slept more than two hours a night.

title: Finland Is a Capitalist Paradise
description: HELSINKI, Finland  Two years ago we were living in a pleasant neighborhood in Brooklyn. We were experienced professionals, enjoying a privileged life. Wed just had a baby. She was our first, and much wanted. We were United States citizens and our future as a family should have seemed bright. But we felt deeply insecure and anxious.

title: My Grandmothers Favorite Scammer
description: BEIJING  One day last winter my mother sent me an odd message over WeChat. Has Laolao said anything strange to you today? she asked.

title: Video Games and Online Chats Are Hunting Grounds for Sexual Predators
description: Criminals are making virtual connections with children through gaming and social media platforms. One popular site warns visitors, Please be careful.

title: How to Protect Your Children From Online Sexual Predators
description: Sexual predators have found an easy access point into the lives of young people: They are meeting them online through multiplayer video games and chat apps, making virtual connections right in their victims homes.

title: Buttigieg Struggles to Square Transparency With Nondisclosure Agreement
description: MT. VERNON, Iowa  Pete Buttigieg rose from small-city obscurity to the top of Iowas presidential polls by saying yes to every interview and presenting himself as an aggressively transparent candidate poised to take on President Trump and his array of known and unknown conflicts.

title: Protesters Killed and Clerics House Bombed in Deepening Iraqi Chaos
description: BAGHDAD  Unknown assailants killed a dozen unarmed anti-government protesters in the Iraqi capital in an attack the president blamed on criminal gangs, and an unmanned drone bombed the home of a prominent Shiite cleric who has been a major supporter of the protest movement.

title: I Have Told Everything, Says Whistle-Blower in China Crackdown
description: LONDON  A Uighur woman living in the Netherlands said on Saturday that she helped publicize secret Chinese government documents that shed light on how Beijing runs mass detention camps holding Muslim ethnic minorities.

title: Cheerleader Punished for Taking a Knee Is Awarded $145,000
description: A former Kennesaw State University cheerleader was awarded a $145,000 settlement two years after she faced repercussions for taking a knee during the national anthem at a college football game, court documents show.

title: Lookin Good!
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  If Emily Carroll was a novelist, Im sure Id be recommending her books to all my friends. Her constructions keep improving, she often incorporates references to things that exist somewhere in my experience (and even sometimes jog pleasant memories), and when we get a theme from her it is, without fail, clever and subtle. Todays is a delight when you get it, a play on a classic compliment. Its a good time of year to note that a correctly-paid compliment isnt difficult  this puzzle, though, was a good challenge!

title: Manchester United Players Targeted With Racial Abuse by City Fans
description: MANCHESTER, England  Manchester United players were targeted with racist abuse and had objects thrown at them by Manchester City fans during Saturdays  derby at the Etihad Stadium.

title: Nikki Haleys Confederate Flag Comments Spark Backlash
description: Nikki Haley, the former South Carolina governor, came under criticism on Friday after she told a conservative radio host that the Confederate flag symbolized service, sacrifice and heritage for some people in her state until Dylann S. Roof hijacked it.

title: Before Florida Shooting, Gunman Showed Off Videos of Mass Attacks
description: PENSACOLA, Fla.  As federal authorities worked on Saturday to piece together clues to last weeks attack at a Florida military training base, new details emerged about the gunman, a Saudi trainee who had apparently shown videos of mass shootings at a dinner party the night before.

title: L.S.U. Makes Case for Top Seed in Playoff With SEC Win
description: ATLANTA  The Southeastern Conference title game was less than three minutes old when the Louisiana State offense stormed onto the turf and started a pair of closing arguments on Saturday. One was to demand the College Football Playoffs top ranking. The other was for the Tigers quarterback, Joe Burrow, to win the Heisman Trophy.

title: For Trump, Instinct After Florida Killings Is Simple: Protect Saudis
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla.  When a Saudi Air Force officer opened fire on his classmates at a naval base in Pensacola, Fla., on Friday, he killed three, wounded eight and exposed anew the strange dynamic between President Trump and the Saudi leadership: The presidents first instinct was to tamp down any suggestion that the Saudi government needed to be held to account.

title: A $120,000 Banana Is Peeled From an Art Exhibition and Eaten
description: In plain sight of art aficionados and influencers, a prankster removed a $120,000 banana from an Art Basel exhibition in Miami Beach on Saturday, peeled it and then ate it.

title: North Korea Turns Up Pressure on the United States for Concessions
description: SEOUL, South Korea  With North Koreas deadline for American concessions fast approaching, the North announced Sunday that it had conducted a very important test at a missile-engine site, rapidly ramping up pressure after months of carefully calibrated provocations.

title: Hong Kong Protest, Largest in Weeks, Stretches Several Miles
description: HONG KONG  Hundreds of thousands of protesters, basking in a recent election victory by Hong Kongs pro-democracy camp, poured onto the citys streets on Sunday in one of the largest marches in weeks to pressure the government to meet demands for greater civil liberties.

title: Keep Undercutting Clemson. The Tigers Have Thrived on It.
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Each time Clemson drops in the polls (despite another unbeaten season) or quarterback Trevor Lawrence throws an interception or somebody dares to mention the schedule, it may as well be red meat dangled under Dabo Swinneys nose.

title: Rachel Brodlie, Griffin Corse
description: Dr. Rachel Mendelssohn Brodlie and Griffin Jerry Corse were married Dec. 5 at their dairy goat farm in Cambridge, Vt. Patrick J. Mayo, a friend of the grooms family who is a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Brenna Davis, Justin LeClair
description: Brenna Lauren Davis and Justin Z. LeClair were married Dec. 7 in an outdoor ceremony at Lovers Key State Park in Fort Myers Beach, Fla. Lanie Davis, the brides sister, became a Universal Life minister for the occasion.

title: Emily Kramer, Jared Shure
description: Emily Lauren Kramer and Jared Albert Shure were married Dec. 7 at the Mansion at Natirar, an events space in Peapack and Gladstone, N.J. Cantor Emanuel C. Perlman officiated

title: Mary Brunelli, Christopher Edgar
description: Mary Claire Brunelli and Christopher Bryan Edgar were married Dec. 7 in Manhattan. The Rev. Brian G. Konzman performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola, where he is an assistant pastor.

title: The Price of Recycling Old Laptops: Toxic Fumes in Thailands Lungs
description: KOH KHANUN, Thailand  Crouched on the ground in a dimly lit factory, the women picked through the discarded innards of the modern world: batteries, circuit boards and bundles of wires.

title: Samantha London, Jason Sunshine
description: Samantha Helen London and Jason Hollander Sunshine were married Dec. 7 at the Rainbow Room, an events space in New York. Rabbi Marc Schneier officiated, with David N. Dinkins, the former mayor of New York and the grooms godfather, taking part.

title: Erica Moody, BJ Barretta
description: Erica Lynn Moody and William Joseph Barretta Jr. are to be married Dec. 8 at the Pen Ryn Estate, an events space in Bensalem, Pa. The couple are to be married in a self-uniting ceremony, as allowed by Pennsylvania law, that is to be led by Gary D. Morgan, a friend of the couple.

title: Amanda Gottlieb, Matthew Seplowe
description: Amanda Beth Gottlieb and Dr. Matthew Paul Seplowe were married Dec. 7 at the Pierre hotel in New York. Rabbi Daniel Gropper officiated.

title: Samantha Melnick, Jonathan Schaefler
description: Samantha Ivy Melnick and Jonathan Schaefler were married Dec. 7 at the Gramercy Park Hotel in New York. Rabbi Jordan Millstein officiated.

title: Althea Webber, Michael Gruen
description: Althea Jenkins Webber and Michael Eli Gruen were married Dec. 7 at Basilica Hudson, an arts and performance space in Hudson, N.Y. Joshua R. Brodie, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for this event, officiated.

title: Molly Ford, Christopher Nixon
description: Molly Bridget Ford and Christopher James Nixon were married Dec. 7 at Indian Creek Country Club in Miami. Bishop J. David Dolence of the Old Roman Catholic Church performed the ceremony.

title: Grace Cao, Elliott Carter
description: Grace Miao Cao and Elliott Charles Carter were married Dec. 4 at the Chelsea Old Town Hall in London. Rebecca Raybone, a registrant of the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea, officiated.

title: Steven Leonardi, Matthew Garrido
description: Steven Mark Leonardi and Matthew Joseph Garrido were married Dec. 7 at Battleground Country Club, in Manalapan, N.J. Kathryn R. Parsons, Mr. Garridos sister, officiated, having become a Universal Life minister for the occasion.

title: New Therapies Help Patients With Dementia Cope With Depression
description: Anne Firmender, 74, was working with her psychologist to come up with a list of her positive attributes.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Hala and The L Word: Generation Q
description: HALA (2019) Stream on Apple TV Plus. Although its not autobiographical, the filmmaker Minhal Baig plumbed aspects of her own childhood in Chicago to tell the story of her title character in Hala. The feature follows the high school senior as she comes to terms with her identity as an American teenager and the daughter of Muslim Pakistani immigrants. As Hala tests the boundaries of faith and sexual desire (her name means halo in Arabic, and it feels like a burden), the movie is unsparing about gender roles and the awkwardness of first-time fumblings, Jeannette Catsoulis wrote in her New York Times review, designating the film a Critics Pick.

title: Corrections: Dec. 8, 2019
description: An article last Sunday about the slow rise of lesbianism on TV misstated which season of Buffy the Vampire Slayer featured a scene in which the characters Willow and Tara are shown in bed together. The scene occurred in the shows sixth season, not its final season. The article also referred incorrectly to the scene. It was not the first lesbian sex scene shown on broadcast television; it showed the characters in bed together, but not engaged in sex. A later scene in that episode with the characters Willow and Kennedy was the first lesbian sex scene on broadcast television.

title: At Least 43 Dead in New Delhi Building Fire
description: NEW DELHI  At least 43 people were killed Sunday morning when one of the worst fires in recent memory in New Delhi broke out in a cramped, commercial neighborhood, officials said.

title: We Are Fleeing the Law: Hong Kong Protesters Escape to Taiwan
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  Sporting T-shirts, tousled hair and backpacks, the trio slumped around a cafeteria table in the Taipei airport looked more like stranded students than a group of protesters on the run.

title: Quotation of the Day: Fearing Injustice in Hong Kong, Droves of Protesters Escape to Taiwan
description: Darkness can never defeat light. I believe democracy and freedom will certainly defeat totalitarianism.

title: Spotting a Young Man, I Asked If He Had a Grandmother
description: Dear Diary:

title: Lovers in Auschwitz, Reunited 72 Years Later. He Had One Question.
description: The first time he spoke to her, in 1943, by the Auschwitz crematory, David Wisnia realized that Helen Spitzer was no regular inmate. Zippi, as she was known, was clean, always neat. She wore a jacket and smelled good. They were introduced by a fellow inmate, at her request.

title: Rei Kawakubo Talks Orlando, Opera and the Performance of Gender
description: On Dec. 8, Orlando will have its premiere at the Vienna State Opera. The opera represents a meeting of female creative minds across time and countries: It is based on the novel by Virginia Woolf, composed by Olga Neuwirth, with a libretto by Ms. Neuwirth and Catherine Filloux, directed by Polly Graham, with costumes by Rei Kawakubo of Comme des Garons.

title: S.N.L.: Paul Rudd, Jimmy Fallon and James Corden Rule the NATO Cafeteria
description: If there are two things that Saturday Night Live loves, its geopolitics and celebrity cameos, and it got to indulge both of these infatuations in this weekends opening sketch, set within the socially ruthless confines of the NATO cafeteria.

title: Homes That Sold for $420,000 or Less
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: At Japans Most Elite University, Just 1 in 5 Students Is a Woman
description: TOKYO  From a young age, Satomi Hayashi studied hard and excelled academically. It seemed only natural that she would follow in her fathers footsteps and attend the University of Tokyo, Japans most prestigious institution.

title: Hundreds of Thousands March in Hong Kong
description: Pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong turned out on Sunday for the largest march in weeks.

title: Impeachment, Pensacola, Interstellar Comet: Your Weekend Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Young Voters Helped Upend Last U.K. Election. Can It Happen Again?
description: SOUTHAMPTON, England  As students from the University of Southampton zigzagged across campus on a recent cold afternoon, youthful activists with Britains main opposition Labour Party intercepted them with cups of tea and a leaflet with detailed instructions on how to register to vote in Decembers election.

title: The Week in Business: Ubers Sexual Assault Problem
description: Its that stressful time in the holiday shopping season when were all playing chicken with sales  wait a little longer, and the price could go down; wait too long, and things will sell out. Some gift options that probably wont get cheaper? French wine, cheese, perfume and handbags, which are the latest victims of President Trumps tariff wars. Heres what to know about that, plus other top stories in the business and tech worlds.

title: Brexit Will Bring a Baby Boom, Boris Johnson Promises
description: LONDON  Add this head-scratching prediction to the list of campaign-trail utterances made by Prime Minister Boris Johnson: Brexit is sure to inspire a baby boom if he remains in office.

title: I.M.F., Endorsing Zelensky, Approves Loan for Ukraine
description: KYIV, Ukraine  The International Monetary Fund has agreed to lend $5.5 billion to Ukraine, a move viewed as a stamp of approval for President Volodymyr Zelenskys anticorruption and economic policies.

title: Reconnecting With His Son, and Picking Himself Back Up
description: For almost a decade, Derrick Manigault saw his son, Jeramiah, two days a week.

title: Songs, Poems and Parodies: Readers Compose Variations
description: (To the tune of My Favorite Things from The Sound of Music)

title: Do You Know Where to Find This New York Architectural Gem?
description: The Guastavinos were a father-son design team that turned unassuming spaces into art. This week we introduce Local Treasure, a new bi-weekly quiz that focuses on the architectural delights scattered around the streets of New York City.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. No one I know loves winter more than Angie Mar, the chef and an owner of the Beatrice Inn in Manhattan. You could find some ski bum kid living the dream life in Durango, Colo., or Whitefish, Mont., or waking up each morning to praise the snow lords of Killington, Vt., a huge smile on his face, ready to shred. But hes a depressive compared to Mar this time of year, when shes cooking dinners of fats on fats, flavors on flavors, beautiful richness to reel the mind.

title: Banana Splits: Spoiled by Its Own Success, the $120,000 Fruit Is Gone
description: The banana that consumed the art world has taken early retirement.

title: What Does This Country Demand of Black Women in Politics?
description: WASHINGTON  The first black woman to be elected mayor of San Francisco, London Breed, considers Senator Kamala Harris something of a political soul mate. When Ms. Harris announced her White House bid in Oakland, Calif., in January, Ms. Breed was one of the 20,000 supporters there loudly celebrating, and she endorsed the campaign from the beginning.

title: Pensacola Shooting Updates: F.B.I. Presumes It Was Terrorism
description: Rachel Rojas, the special agent in charge of the Federal Bureau of Investigations Jacksonville field office, said on Sunday that the presumption of terrorism allows law enforcement agencies to more quickly identify and eliminate any potential threats to the community. None have been identified so far, she said.

title: Juice WRLD Dies at 21; Chicago Rapper Whose Star Was on the Rise
description: Juice WRLD, one of a crop of sweet-voiced singing rappers who emerged from the streaming platform SoundCloud in recent years, died on Sunday in a hospital in Oak Lawn, Ill. He was 21.

title: How the Constitution Defines Impeachable, Word by Word
description: What treason, bribery, or other high crimes and misdemeanors really means.

title: Ban on Surprise Medical Bills May Pass After All
description: Turns out, even as the impeachment debate blazes, Democrats and Republicans can agree on one thing: They dont like surprise medical bills.

title: The Internet Swallowed INXS. Can a Movie Rescue Its Legacy?
description: In the opening scenes of the concert film Live Baby Live, INXS bangs out Guns in the Sky, an anti-nukes anthem from its six-times-platinum 1987 album Kick. As beats reverberate across Londons old Wembley Stadium, the Australian rock bands appeal leaps to life: funky guitar rhythms, saxophones, tight trousers and the soulful flow of the singer Michael Hutchences voice.

title: Would Prince Have Wanted His Rough Drafts Made Public?
description: Prince was a perfectionist. He was a relentlessly creative musician and a refined aesthete, careful about the music he put out in the world, always presenting a seamless package  image and sound.

title: The College Football Playoff Is Set, and L.S.U. Is No. 1
description: The potential for chaos gave way to consensus: Louisiana State, Ohio State, Clemson and Oklahoma will compete for a national title after their selections on Sunday for the College Football Playoff.

title: Caroll Spinney, Big Birds Alter Ego on Sesame Street, Is Dead at 85
description: Sometimes he stood 8 feet 2 inches tall. Sometimes he lived in a garbage can. He often cited numbers and letters of the alphabet, and for nearly a half century on Sesame Street he was Big Bird and Oscar the Grouch, opening magic doors for children on the secrets of growing up and the gentle arts of friendship.

title: Will Russia Be Thrown Out of the Olympics on Monday? A Primer
description: There is a little more than seven months left before the opening of the 2020 Olympics, and, once again, Russia is bracing for yet another potentially severe punishment after yet another accusation of state-sponsored, performance-enhancing, sports-tainting doping malfeasance.

title: West Point Strips Racist Motto From Its Football Team Flag
description: The United States Military Academy has stripped a motto from its football team spirit flag because of its connection to hate groups, the academy said on Sunday.

title: Review: At Alvin Ailey, Tragic Themes Overwhelm a Dance
description: No one knows exactly what happened in 1921 when a young black man stepped into an elevator operated by a white woman in the Greenwood district of Tulsa, Okla., but the aftermath was horrific. The man was arrested, and a white mob descended on the area, an affluent black enclave, and destroyed it. Hundreds were killed, injured or left homeless by the destruction.

title: With White House Absent, Impeachment Devolves Into Partisan Brawl
description: WASHINGTON  Almost from the moment that Speaker Nancy Pelosi and her lieutenants decided this fall to pursue the impeachment of President Trump, they made a fateful judgment: If the president intended to do nothing but stonewall and subvert their inquiry, they were not going to be the ones politely sticking to lofty traditions.

title: Podcasts About Beyonc, Arias and Health Care: Worth a Listen
description: At the end of a year filled with more podcast debuts than ever, its sometimes easy to overlook returning shows just as worthy of your time. If you havent given them a try yet, there are plenty of past episodes for your ears to indulge during holiday travels. Below are some recent podcasts that came back for new seasons, followed by a few newcomers to check out.

title: As Water Runs Low, Can Life in the Outback Go On?
description: EUCHAREENA, Australia  Fleur Magick Dennis has stopped showering every day, allowed her vegetable patch to die and told her four sons to let the dishes pile up. Sometimes, all her family has is bottled water, and they have to preserve every drop.

title: A Farewell to Feministing and the Heyday of Feminist Blogging
description: Soon after Anna Holmes took on the job of building the website Jezebel, in 2007, she set it apart from established publications like Vogue and Elle with a post offering $10,000 to anyone who would send in the best unretouched version of a womens magazine cover photo. And with that, Jezebel had marked its territory: feminist cultural criticism, with an edge.

title: Marvin Goodfriend, Trump Nominee to the Federal Reserve, Dies at 69
description: Marvin Goodfriend, a leading conservative monetary economist and former nominee to the Federal Reserve Board, died on Thursday at his home in Pittsburgh. He was 69.

title: Hong Kong, Pensacola Shooting, Art Basel: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Bump Elliott, College Football Star and Coach, Dies at 94
description: Bump Elliott, the All-American halfback on an unbeaten University of Michigan football team who later coached the Wolverines for a decade, then rebuilt the sports program at the University of Iowa as its longtime athletic director, died on Saturday in Iowa City.  He was 94.

title: Frozen 2 Continues to Outdo Its Predecessor at the Box Office
description: The Disney animated musical Frozen 2 again dominated domestic theaters this weekend, leading the box office for the third weekend in a row.

title: This Man May Be Big Techs Biggest Threat
description: WASHINGTON  At a hearing this summer about the rising power of the countrys biggest tech companies, Representative David Cicilline zeroed in on Amazon. Unhappy with a response from one of the companys top lawyers, he delivered a biting retort.

title: Does Trump Think Our Constitutional Processes Are Beneath Him?
description: President Trump has now made obvious his contempt for the notion that Congress has any authority to hold him accountable. He has signaled that he wont mount any defense to impeachment charges in the House over his scheming in Ukraine, insisting it is somehow beneath him to participate in a constitutional process.

title: Sleeping Car Porters Review: Billy the Kid Meets the Zodiac Killer
description: The warning comes early in Ryan William Downeys Sleeping Car Porters as a voice-over welcomes us to the story  and when I say story I really mean a patchwork of moments.

title: Donald B. Marron, Financier, Art Collector and Philanthropist, Dies at 85
description: Donald B. Marron, a prominent Wall Street financier and philanthropist and a major figure in the New York art world, died on Friday in Manhattan. He was 85.

title: 5-Year-Old Carries Baby in Subzero Cold After They Are Abandoned, Police Say
description: A 5-year-old, wearing just socks and light clothing, carried an 18-month-old through subzero temperatures in the Yukon Flats of Alaska after the power went out at the home where they had been left alone, according to the authorities.

title: Trump Cripples W.T.O. as Trade War Rages
description: WASHINGTON  The United States has spent two years chipping away at the World Trade Organization, criticizing it as unfair, starving it of personnel and disregarding its authority, as President Trump seeks to upend the global trade system.

title: A (Grudging) Defense of the $120,000 Banana
description: Art may be long, and life short, but the existence of a hand fruit is most ephemeral of all. This week at Art Basel Miami Beach, the art worlds premier Champagne-steeped swap meet, no work drew more grins, guffaws and selfies than a new sculpture by the semiretired Italian trickster Maurizio Cattelan: a banana duct-taped to the wall, its peel already speckled with brown spots.

title: Release the Influencers! Quibis Plan for Streaming Success
description: LOS ANGELES  Jeffrey Katzenberg and Meg Whitman, the founders of Quibi, a short-form video app scheduled for an April 6 debut, are trying to create a platform for the smartphone age. To entice subscribers, they have ordered big-budget shows from known quantities like Kevin Hart and Steven Spielberg  but they have turned to social media stars for the kind of casual, low-commitment programming that could make Quibi a daily habit.

title: First Wonder Woman 1984 Trailer: Steve Trevor Is Somehow Back
description: We wanted to bring Wonder Woman into the modern world, the director Patty Jenkins said before introducing the first trailer for Wonder Woman 1984 at CCXP, the Comic Con Experience convention in So Paulo, Brazil, on Sunday.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Dec. 9, 2019
description: Students

title: Rosario Dawson Hits the Trail in Iowa. (Her Boyfriend Is Running for President.)
description: IOWA CITY  Senator Cory Booker was in a frantic sprint for a little extra zest in Iowa.

title: Margaret Lawrence, 105, Dies; Pioneering Black Female Psychoanalyst
description: As a senior at Cornell in the 1930s, Margaret Lawrence had a nearly perfect academic record and expected to attend the universitys medical school. But Ms. Lawrence (she was Margaret Morgan at the time), the only black student in her class, was denied admission.

title: Barr Dives Into the Culture Wars, and Social Conservatives Rejoice
description: WASHINGTON  When President Trump nominated William P. Barr as attorney general a year ago, establishment Republicans who had chafed at Mr. Trumps takeover of their party were relieved. Between Mr. Barrs work in the Reagan White House and his fast-track career under George Bush, he could be a bridge to the Republican Party they knew  and preferred.

title: Completely Enchanted
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  When we met the constructor Ellis Hay in March, there were Bs buzzing all over the place. He is back with a nice, straightforward Monday puzzle that would make a great point of entry for any new solver.

title: Air Force Aims to Deploy a New Battlefield Weapon: Faster Communications
description: SIMI VALLEY, Calif.  The Air Force will propose spending $9 billion over the next five years to build a system to automatically send intelligence to front-line forces, new technology that strategists say will change how the military fights and will help deter aggression by Russia and China.

title: Protesters Are Fleeing Hong Kong. A Secret Network Is Helping Them.
description: Risk years of imprisonment or flee? We traced the journey along a covert pipeline helping Hong Kong protesters escape to Taiwan.

title: The Eight Counts of Impeachment That Trump Deserves
description: During Watergate, the House Judiciary Committee considered five articles of impeachment against Richard Nixon  and voted down two of them. During the impeachment of Bill Clinton, the House voted on four articles  and rejected two.

title: Ren Auberjonois, a Deep Space Nine Star, Dies at 79
description: Ren Auberjonois, a sought-after character actor whose hundreds of roles included a governors officious assistant in Benson, an alien security officer on Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, a managing partner in Boston Legal and a con man who gets Huck Finn into hot water in the Broadway musical Big River, died on Sunday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 79.

title: The Gig Economys Sexual Misconduct Problem, and How to Fix It
description: Uber has released its long-awaited safety report, detailing sexual assaults, fatal physical assaults and motor vehicle fatalities in the United States. The results on sexual assault are disturbing: nearly 6,000 incidents in 2017 and 2018 combined, ranging from nonconsensual touching to rape.

title: Trump Brings 2 Officers He Cleared of War Crimes Onstage at Fund-Raiser
description: President Trump brought two soldiers he had pardoned in cases involving war crimes onstage at a fund-raiser this weekend in Florida, tightening his embrace of an episode that roiled his relationship with military leaders and prompted a public outcry.

title: The N.F.C.s Best Team? San Francisco Makes a High-Scoring Case
description: NEW ORLEANS  Across the last month, the best team in the N.F.C. has been more of an abstract concept than an unassailable certainty. The contenders relish cannibalizing one another. The distinction shifts week to week.

title: Pensacola Victims: Three Hopeful Men at the Dawn of Naval Careers
description: Three young men, one of them not yet 20, recently arrived in the Florida Panhandle, fresh-faced and eager to pursue their dreams at the cradle of American naval aviation.

title: Oh, Nikki. Youre So Wrong.
description: There was a moment in which people thought  and many liberals feared  that Nikki Haley, former South Carolina governor and former United States ambassador to the United Nations, would be the post-Donald Trump face of the Republican Party as a political candidate.

title: The Indispensable Man: How Giuliani Led Trump to the Brink of Impeachment
description: Not so long ago, it seemed to Rudolph W. Giuliani that he would be presiding over a hefty part of the world.

title: NATO Conference Is Canceled After U.S. Ambassador Barred a Trump Critic
description: The United States ambassador to Denmark barred an American NATO expert critical of President Trump from speaking at an international conference hosted by the American embassy and a Danish think tank, prompting the events cancellation, organizers said.

title: Pensacola Attack Probed for Terrorism Link. Saudi Suspect Clashed With Instructor.
description: The investigation into the fatal shooting last week at a Navy training center in Florida was officially characterized as a terrorism inquiry on Sunday, as new details emerged about the Saudi Air Force trainee who killed three sailors on the base where he was a visiting student.

title: Patriots Run Out of Comebacks in Testy Rematch Against Chiefs
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  Trailing at home by 16 points in the third quarter on Sunday evening, the New England Patriots had already been booed off the field three times. Tom Brady, the epitome of cool, had snapped in the first half, furiously charging at a mammoth Kansas City defensive lineman after a jarring tackle. The Patriots beleaguered young wide receivers, blamed for everything that has troubled New Englanders this month except for last weeks snowstorm, had dropped two pivotal passes.

title: Keep Review: Daniel Kitson Takes Inventory
description: Youve been warned. At the beginning of Daniel Kitsons Keep at St. Anns Warehouse, a frustrating show in ways that Kitson does and doesnt intend, Kitson tells you that what youre about to see is not a stand-up comedy show, but neither is it one of the powerful pieces of storytelling theater I have made my own.

title: Watchmen Season 1, Episode 8 Recap: Chicken or Egg?
description: By definition, dont all relationships end in tragedy?

title: Mr. Robot Season 4, Episode 10 Recap: Run Away With Me
description: And now, a breather.

title: After Eruption in New Zealand, 5 Dead, 8 Missing and No Signs of Life
description: WHAKATANE, New Zealand  They had taken boats to a desolate island to get a glimpse of a natural wonder, but when the White Island volcano erupted on Monday,  a scene of stunning beauty suddenly turned into a deadly trap.

title: Elizabeth Warren Earned $1.9 Million Over 3 Decades for Corporate and Legal Work
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren disclosed a detailed list of compensation she received during 30 years of moonlighting as a legal consultant  about $1.9 million in all  as she and Mayor Pete Buttigieg continued a back-and-forth demanding transparency in the race for the Democratic presidential nomination.

title: Madam Secretary Proved TV Didnt Have to Be Hip to Be Great
description: Heres to loving one of the least-hip shows on TV. To its earnest parenting, its destabilizing cast changes, its long seasons. Get excited for a cameo from Colin Powell, as himself! Marvel at the variety of accents being attempted! Can we interest you in some passionate descriptions of diplomacy and an occasional mention of Thomas Aquinas?

title: Even a Little Alcohol May Raise Cancer Risk
description: Even moderate alcohol consumption may increase the risk for cancer.

title: Study Examines Why Black Americans Remain Scarce in Executive Suites
description: [Please sign up here to have the Race/Related newsletter delivered weekly to your inbox.]

title: N.F.L. Week 14: What We Learned
description: A week ago, San Francisco lost a defensive thriller in Baltimore. This week, they won a shootout in New Orleans against Drew Brees and the Saints. Doubt the 49ers all you want, but you cant accuse them of not having range. In what may prove to be the biggest week of the season in terms of strong head-to-head matchups, the 49ers cemented themselves as Super Bowl contenders, the Baltimore Ravens held on for a tough win over the Buffalo Bills and the Kansas City Chiefs, with some help from the officials, upset the New England Patriots in Foxborough.

title: A Few Cities Have Cornered Innovation Jobs. Can That Be Changed?
description: There are about a dozen industries at the frontier of innovation. They include software and pharmaceuticals, semiconductors and data processing. Most of their workers have science or tech degrees. They invest heavily in research and development. While they account for only 3 percent of all jobs, they account for 6 percent of the countrys economic output.

title: Barr Allows for Release of Additional Details About Ex-Spy Behind Steele Dossier
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General William P. Barr recently approved making public new details about a former F.B.I. informant at the heart of conservatives allegations about the Russia investigation, deciding to release information that had been blacked out in a highly anticipated inspector generals report due out on Monday.

title: Brexit, France, Hong Kong: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Quotation of the Day: Air Force Sees Data as $9 Billion Weapon
description: People go home and data from all over the world gets to their devices. They go to war and they get data from almost nowhere.

title: No Corrections: Dec. 9, 2019
description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, Dec. 9, 2019.

title: You Live Your Life Online. Dont Forget Your Manners
description: I have made many a digital etiquette faux pas in my time. I used to be that person in the office who always replied to a group email first to show how keen I was, but really I was just coming across as annoying and needy. I spammed my social media with MySpace-angle selfies  camera held aloft, lips pouting like a fish  in my formative online years. I have even ghosted someone.

title: Whats on TV Monday: Bridesmaids and It Comes at Night
description: BRIDESMAIDS (EXTENDED VERSION) (2011) Stream on HBO. Rent on Amazon, Google Play, iTunes, Vudu and YouTube. Paul Feig directs as Kristen Wiig stars as Annie, the disastrous maid of honor for the wedding of her lifelong friend Lillian (Maya Rudolph). The movie, written by Wiig and Annie Mumolo, follows the chaotic gaggle of bridesmaids through the ups and downs of matrimonial rites of passage  dress fittings, bachelorette parties, bridal showers  and twists each ritual into a new catastrophe. As Manohla Dargis wrote of Bridesmaids in her Times review, Ms. Wiig and Ms. Mumolo want to make you giggle and snort  but they get at the layers of insanity in weddings as well as the joys.

title: Amid Impeachment Drama, a Bipartisan Celebration of the Arts
description: WASHINGTON Speaker Nancy Pelosi of California, in a full-length gown, waved to a standing ovation from a star-studded menagerie of Washington on Sunday in the Kennedy Center Opera House, just hours before the impeachment inquiry was set to resume the next morning.

title: Where Bicyclists, Doormen and Tourists Battle for Turf
description: Jason Seda saw the car door open and the man get out. He also saw the bicycle coming.

title: Ohio State Struggled in the Big Ten Title Game. Tougher Teams Await.
description: INDIANAPOLIS  The uncertainty for unbeaten Ohio State going into the Big Ten championship game wasnt about whether the Buckeyes needed to beat Wisconsin to make the College Football Playoff. It was about what they could showcase for the Playoffs committee as they made a final push for the top seed.

title: Despite Warnings, Trump Moves to Expand Migrant Family Detention
description: DILLEY, Texas  On a burning hot day last summer at the South Texas Family Residential Center, a federal detention facility for immigrant families, Kenia and her son, Michael, 11, were hunched over a foosball table in an air-conditioned recreation room when Michael dropped to the floor and started sobbing. He curled his body into a ball and writhed as if he were in pain.

title: What Are Your Experiences With Meditation?
description: Do you have any effective ways to protect yourself from the distractions and stressors of daily life? Or to quiet your mind? Have you ever tried meditating or practicing mindfulness?

title: We Beat Sleep Apnea. It Should Be Easier for You to Do It, Too.
description: Both of us have sleep apnea, and both of us receive treatment that makes a world of difference.

title: Are Sugar Substitutes Good for Kids?
description: Even the name, nonnutritive sweeteners, sounds like it was invented to avoid, well, sugarcoating the issue. We used to call them artificial sweeteners; this new term is intended to emphasize that they have no nutritional content  no vitamins, no minerals, no calories, or very few (thats the whole point).

title: When Drug Side Effects Pose Real Dangers
description: About a month ago, I took myself off a medication without first contacting the doctor who prescribed it, a step I have often cautioned others never to do. A neurologist had put me on the anticonvulsant drug Keppra as a preventive in case a seizure had caused an otherwise unexplained fall on my head and brief memory loss.

title: Michelle Wolf Doesnt Want to Be Your Folk Hero
description: It seems like every comic has a routine that deals with outrage culture. But when Michelle Wolf addresses it, you can be sure she is speaking from experience.

title: A Jeweler Makes the Most of Her Hudson Yards Studio
description: For many New Yorkers, living in a full-service doorman building simply means being able to receive Amazon packages and FreshDirect shipments headache-free. But for Madhuri Parson, a sixth-generation jeweler whose Hudson Yards studio has doubled as her companys base of operations since she moved there in the summer of 2016, it was an absolute must.

title: The Ferrante Effect: In Italy, Women Writers Are Ascendant
description: ROME  In Italy, literary fiction has long been considered a mans game. Publishers, critics and prize committees have dismissed books by women as chick lit and beach reads. They scoffed at Elena Ferrante, the author of My Brilliant Friend, as the writer of mere page-turners.

title: Violent Protests and Free Speech: Whos to Blame for an Officers Injuries?
description: WASHINGTON  The lawsuit, a federal judge found, bordered on the delusional. A Louisiana police officer injured in a protest tried to sue the hashtag #BlackLivesMatter, which amounted, wrote Judge Brian A. Jackson of the Federal District Court in Baton Rouge, to picking a fight with an idea. A hashtag, Judge Jackson wrote, is patently incapable of being sued.

title: Marriage Story and The Irishman Propel Netflix to Most Golden Globe Nominations
description: LOS ANGELES  It is Netflixs world. Hollywood just lives in it.

title: Jacqueline Woodson on Africa, America and Slaverys Fierce Undertow
description: IN THE COASTAL TOWN of Elmina, Ghana, the Atlantic Ocean crashes against the rocks with such a ferocity, I make our kids move back away from the gray-blue water. Four hundred years have passed since captured Africans were forced across these waves on their way to bondage in the New World and now, standing at the edge of this violent water, startled by my own anxiety, I feel something deep and old and terrifying. Call it hydrophobia. Call it genetic memory. Ive always had a fear of the ocean, the fierce pull of its undercurrent, the crest of its powerful waves and most of all, its seeming infinity  the way it moves to a place where the skyline caresses it. Then drops off into nothing at all.

title: Highlights From the Horowitz Report on the Russia Investigation
description: WASHINGTON  A much-anticipated report on the early stages of the F.B.I.s investigation into possible ties between the Trump campaign and Russia heavily criticized how the F.B.I. obtained court orders to eavesdrop on a former Trump campaign aide but found no evidence of political bias or improper motivation by the F.B.I.

title: The 25 Rooms That Influence the Way We Design
description: On an October afternoon, our six-person jury  Tom Delavan, the design and interiors director of T Magazine; Gabriel Hendifar, the creative director of the Manhattan-based lighting and design studio Apparatus; the architect Toshiko Mori; the architect and designer Daniel Romualdez; the veteran design journalist Suzanne Slesin; and the interiors photographer Simon Watson  assembled in a featureless conference room at The New York Times to discuss the most influential rooms of all time. By that, we meant influential in its truest sense. We wanted the jury to identify the spaces that not only changed the way we live but also changed the way we see, places  whether pleasing, provocative or completely novel for their eras  that not only informed our panelists individual practices as designers and documenters but also challenged how we all, as humans, think about beauty, strangeness, originality, dcor, proportion, furnishings, art and the multivalent connections therein that define memorable rooms: ones that, above all, offer a new kind of visual lexicon. These are rooms, in other words, that have influenced and inspired interior design throughout the decades, shaping how our mind identifies and assesses a space, any space.

title: How Much Do You Know About Costa Rica?
description: Can you find Costa Rica on a map? What else do you know about this Central American nation with about 5 million people?

title: Tensions Over Subway Policing, Race and Arrest Quotas
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Russia Banned From Olympics and Global Sports for 4 Years Over Doping
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland  The worlds top antidoping authority on Monday banished Russia from international competition  including next summers Olympic Games in Tokyo  for four years, the latest and most severe punishment yet connected to a yearslong cheating scheme that has tarnished sports, rendered Russia a sports pariah and exacerbated tension between Moscow and the West.

title: India Steps Toward Making Naturalization Harder for Muslims
description: HYDERABAD, India  India took a major step toward the official marginalization of Muslims on Tuesday as one house of Parliament passed a bill that would establish a religious test for migrants who want to become citizens, solidifying Prime Minister Narendra Modis Hindu-nationalist agenda.

title: Sanna Marin of Finland to Become Worlds Youngest Prime Minister
description: HELSINKI, Finland  Sanna Marin, 34, is set to become the worlds youngest sitting prime minister when she is sworn in this week in Finland, after being elected to the position by her party late Sunday.

title: Russia, New Zealand, Golden Globes: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Great Recycling Con
description: The greatest trick companies ever played was making us think we could recycle their products.

title: The Great Recycling Con
description: In the Video Op-Ed above, we debunk a recycling myth that has lulled us into guilt-free consumption for decades.

title: A Policy to Quash the Womens Wave. From Democrats.
description: Over the next few months, candidates across the country will file papers so they can run for Congress. But well never know how many talented women and people of color sit out, discouraged by a rule the House Democrats imposed in March that prohibits anyone working to oust an incumbent from doing business with the party.

title: Ron Lauder Pledges $25 Million for Campaign Against Anti-Semitism
description: Ronald S. Lauder, the cosmetics billionaire and president of the World Jewish Congress, is setting aside $25 million of his own money to start a new organization devoted to rooting out what he sees as the growing tide of anti-Semitism in American politics.

title: Did Pete Buttigieg Help Black People in South Bend?
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind.  Pete Buttigieg is rarely home these days as he scoots from South Carolina to New Hampshire to Iowa in pursuit of primary voters.

title: A Womans Journey Through Chinas Detention Camps
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: The Children of ISIS Dont Belong in Cages, Either
description: Children peer out from behind the bars into the light, scarred by intense trauma and uncertain of their future, terrified both of their prison and the outside world. The images and stories of these youngsters, robbed of their childhood by the extreme violence of life under the Islamic State, are harrowing. Many are unaccompanied, the large majority are under 12. They now find themselves abandoned in appalling conditions in rudimentary camps in Syria. Governments have to do better: This is not the way to treat children who are also victims of terrorism. Nor is it effective counterterrorism policy.

title: Trump Administration Hinders Authority of W.T.O.
description: Beijing has ordered all state government offices and public institutions to remove foreign computer equipment and software within three years and switch to domestic vendors. (What this by email? Sign up here.)

title: Marriage Story | Anatomy of a Scene
description: Noah Baumbach narrates a sequence from A Marriage Story, featuring Adam Driver and Scarlett Johansson.

title: How to Shoot the Start of a Relationships End in Marriage Story
description: In Anatomy of a Scene, we ask directors to reveal the secrets that go into making key scenes in their movies. See new episodes in the series each Friday. You can also watch our collection of more than 150 videos on YouTube and subscribe to our YouTube channel.

title: Facing Criticism Over Muslim Camps, China Says: Whats the Problem?
description: BEIJING  On Twitter and YouTube, with slick videos and strident editorials, the Chinese government has gone on the offensive to reject mounting evidence that it is detaining Muslims in droves, depicting its critics as players in a Western conspiracy.

title: There Were No Safety Features: Outrage Follows New Delhi Fire
description: NEW DELHI  The phone calls started before dawn, frantic young men dialing relatives in faraway villages. As a fire engulfed the building where they worked and slept in New Delhi, blocking exits and filling rooms with smoke, the trapped men bid loved ones goodbye through sobs.

title: Impeachment Hearing Takeaways: Democrats Allege Brazen Trump Scheme While Republicans Lament Unfair Process
description: Democrats and Republicans who squared off at Mondays impeachment hearing in the House Judiciary Committee had one remarkable point of agreement: Both said that there are four key facts at the heart of the debate about whether President Trump should be impeached by the House and removed from office.

title: In First Meeting With Putin, Zelensky Plays to a Draw Despite a Bad Hand
description: PARIS  It had the makings of a singularly unequal contest: a former K.G.B. officer and seasoned master of no-holds-barred global intrigue versus a former comedian bereft of any experience in power politics and battered by his countrys bruising encounters with President Trump.

title: Who Is Barry Berke? Judiciary Committees Lawyer Will Present Impeachment Case
description: WASHINGTON  When Democrats on the House Judiciary Committee present their opening arguments for impeaching President Trump on Monday, they will turn not to a seasoned prosecutor but to one of the nations leading defense lawyers to set the stage.

title: Sweden Charges Ex-Ambassador to China Over Secret Meetings
description: Swedens former ambassador to China has been charged with arbitrariness during negotiations with a foreign power, after she held what Swedish prosecutors said on Monday were unauthorized meetings with two men representing Chinese state interests.

title: An Art History Mystery with No Shortage of Sleuths
description: Is it a 5 or a 6? a New York Times headline asked readers several days ago as the article detailed an art history dispute that is roiling the curatorial ranks. It was the kind of question that inspired the detectives among our readers. The story also sparked a debate among readers, akin to 2015s viral blue dress or gold dress discussion, that highlighted how two people can look at the same image and see very different things.

title: Trump Officials Block U.N. Meeting on Human Rights Abuses in North Korea
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration has refused to support a move by members of the United Nations Security Council to hold a discussion Tuesday on North Koreas rampant human rights abuses, effectively blocking the meeting for the second year in a row.

title: Lesson of the Day: Around the World in 5 Kids Games
description: Featured Article: Around the World in 5 Kids Games
