description: BEIJING  For the first seven months after her divorce, Li Xiuping thought her former husband had disappeared from her life. Then came the phone call that turned Ms. Li, a journalist for a state-run newspaper in Beijing, into a dogged activist for the economic rights of Chinese women.

title: Sarah Huckabee Sanders Apologizes for Mocking Bidens Remarks on Stuttering
description: Sarah Huckabee Sanders apologized late Thursday after she mocked comments by former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. during the Democratic presidential debate in which he recounted mentoring a boy who had a speech impediment.

title: Suspect in Harry Dunn Crash Is Charged, British Prosecutors Say
description: LONDON  An American woman who fled Britain after her car collided with a teenage motorcyclist in central England in August while she was driving on the wrong side of the road has been charged with causing death by dangerous driving, British prosecutors said on Friday.

title: How Greta Gerwig Built Her Little Women
description: The novel was just the beginning. Greta Gerwigs adaptation of Louisa May Alcotts Little Women is so teeming with references  literary, artistic, cinematic  that it cries out for a syllabus. Every line and every moment in this movie could be footnoted, Gerwig said. I hope this doesnt make it sound utterly dull, but its a thesis.

title: The Sheds Second Seasonto Feature New Commissions and Familiar Faces
description: As it settles into New Yorks cultural fabric, the Shed  the $475 million arts center in Hudson Yards that opened earlier this year  has a question to answer: After a flashy first season that has included a kung fu musical, Bjrk and a concert series conceived by the director Steve McQueen, how do you keep people interested?

title: She Quickened the Pulse of 17th-Century Music
description: Like many celebrated musicians, Barbara Strozzi has a Facebook page with thousands of followers. Though in this, her 400th birthday year, shes hardly a household name like Beethoven or Mozart, the page is active with announcements of concerts, album releases and articles.

title: Reading the Signs When a Couple of Papal Pals Get to Talking
description: The pages of a large Gospel, lying on the unadorned wooden coffin, fluttered in the breeze. Cardinals in red and bishops in purple stood in ranks nearby, and millions of mourners filled St. Peters Square and surrounding streets for the vast spectacle that was Pope John Paul IIs funeral in 2005.

title: The 30 Best International TV Shows of the Decade
description: If streaming was the television story of the decade, then close behind was the explosion of global content that came to American screens to help fill all that new bandwidth. Shows suddenly appeared from all over the world, most noticeably financed or acquired by Netflix but also flooding in through a myriad of other streaming services and cable networks. Americans will read subtitles, it turns out. (Id prefer to think no ones choosing the dubbed English soundtracks.)

title: The Best Poetry Books of 2019
description: Its been the sort of year in which it often seems, as W. B. Yeats famously put it, that the center cannot hold. The kind of year in which things fly apart. The kind of year in which the best lack all conviction, while the worst wind up on the New York Times best-seller list because the Republican National Committee has bought huge quantities of their booklike object.

title: MS-13 Gang: 96 Charged in Sweeping Crackdown on Long Island
description: Over the course of 150 pages, the indictment described a remarkably vast criminal enterprise. There were seven murder plots with guns, machetes and Molotov cocktails. There were assaults in bars, meetings in local bakeries and gang initiations with 13-second beatings.

title: Prince Philip Is Hospitalized
description: LONDON  Prince Philip, the 98-year-old husband of Queen Elizabeth II of Britain, was taken to a hospital in London on Friday as a precautionary measure to treat a pre-existing condition, Buckingham Palace said in a statement.

title: U.K. Parliament Advances Brexit Bill in Lopsided Vote, All but Assuring January Exit
description: LONDON  After more than three years of anguished national debate, multiple cliff-hanging votes, and two general elections, Britains Parliament voted by a wide margin on Friday to advance Prime Minister Boris Johnsons Brexit plan, paving the way for the country to leave the European Union next month.

title: January Debate Will Be Harder to Qualify For, D.N.C. Announces
description: LOS ANGELES  One day after seven candidates took the stage for the most intimate debate of the Democratic presidential primary cycle so far, the Democratic National Committee increased the qualification standards for its next debate in January, making it likely that the field of candidates will be winnowed even further for the event.

title: The Old Man and the Greek: N.B.A. Tale Needs Only a Great Ending
description: MILWAUKEE  Early in the fourth quarter, the Los Angeles Lakers, those gold-and-purple princes with their lordly leader LeBron James, awakened from a slumber and were pressing the Milwaukee Bucks, cutting a once mountainous lead to single digits.

title: As Modi Pushes Hindu Agenda, a Secular India Fights Back
description: NEW DELHI  Wearing Muslim skullcaps, colorful turbans of Indian Sikhs or hip beanies of secular university students, thousands protested at the largest mosque in Indias capital on Friday, a turbulent scene that played out in multiple cities across the country. They defied government curfews, internet shutdowns and the divisive politics that have kept them apart for years.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Good morning. Its the longest night of the year this weekend, Saturday night, the hibernal solstice, a chance to light candles, make and eat St. Lucia buns, smothered shrimp in crab-meat gravy, okonomi-latkes piled high with salmon roe. I think maybe Id like to make chicken Francese (above), this years most popular recipe on NYT Cooking, and pair it with spaghetti tossed with a little olive oil and a lot of Parmesan, some garlic bread on the side.

title: In Roald Dahls Car
description: It was a Sunday night in 1971. The sky was black. The road was black. I couldnt see my feet. I couldnt see where the tarmac ended and the grass verge began. I had to get home to Aylesbury that night. I was 19.

title: You Should Be Freaking Out About Privacy
description: Nothing to hide, nothing to fear? Think again.

title: You Should Be Freaking Out About Privacy
description: The surveillance state is the stuff of dystopian novels and futuristic thrillers. Or, as revealed in the Video Op-Ed above, its here now. With ad trackers on our phones, facial recognition cameras on our streets and N.S.A. agents listening in on our phone calls, Big Brother is watching.

title: Why I Voted Against the Trump Impeachment
description: As I walked into the House chamber on Wednesday evening, I had flashbacks to a sadly familiar scene. Just a day short of 21 years ago, I had cast my votes to impeach President Bill Clinton and was then selected to serve as a House manager  a prosecutor  to argue our case before the Senate. While the Clinton impeachment was a bitterly divisive moment in our history, I did what I believed  and still believe  was right.

title: Gun Enthusiast Is Identified as Russian Spy Agencys Attacker
description: MOSCOW  The gunman who attacked the headquarters of Russias feared security agency this week and killed one of its agents was an unemployed security guard and gun enthusiast, various Russian news outlets reported on Friday.

title: Women Dominate This Sport. Why Is the Coaching a Boys Club?
description: PITTSBURGH  As Taylor Morgans volleyball career at the University of Minnesota comes to an end this week, she has set her sights on becoming a college coach. She understands what the career entails from her father, who coaches track and field at Minnesota, and she is confident that she will take the lessons taught by her respected coach, Hugh McCutcheon, and figure out the rest.

title: Iranian Families Divided by the Trump Travel Ban Tell of Holidays Apart and Lives on Hold
description: With the holidays and a long school break almost here and many families gathering together, we reached out to those who have been affected by President Trumps travel ban to see how they and their relatives are managing.

title: Review: A Rare Showcase for Bach. His Sons, That Is.
description: Johann Sebastian Bach was both the scion and the father of musicians: Four of his 20 children became significant composers. These sons were, in their own time, the innovators in the family; though acknowledged as a master craftsman, J.S. was seen as somewhat old-fashioned as the Baroque period gave way to new styles.

title: Ward Just, 84, Dies; Ex-Journalist Found Larger Truths in Fiction
description: Ward Just, a journalist for whom the Vietnam War was both a personal trauma and a national tragedy, inspiring him to write novels about people whose lives are shaped by war, political intrigue, myopic diplomats and other forces beyond their control, died on Thursday at a hospital in Plymouth, Mass. He was 84.

title: At the Edge of the World, a New Battleground for the U.S. and China
description: TORSHAVN, Faroe Islands  The mere existence of the Faroe Islands is a wonder. Tall peaks of snow-patched volcanic rock jut out from the North Atlantic Ocean. Steep cliffs plunge into the deep waters of narrow fjords.

title: Four Breakfasts as Festive as the Season
description: With all the joyful chaos of the holidays  the presents, the parties, the cookies, the big, boozy dinners  it can be easy to forget about the most important meal of the day: breakfast.

title: From Harlem to Italy, Sounds of Gay Subversion
description: Riffing off the popularity of the Tin Pan Alley hit The Sheik of Araby, Fats Waller and Porter Grainger celebrated a very different kind of exotic locale in their 1920s song In Harlems Araby. With lyrics by Jo Trent, the song tells of the Manhattan neighborhood where it was said that strait-laced propriety didnt apply and rules could be flouted.

title: Once, America Had Its Own Parrot
description: When European settlers arrived in North America, they were stunned to discover a gorgeous parrot.

title: The Chicken to Crave
description: Hi and welcome to Five Weeknight Dishes. Are you feeling a little spent, a little stuffy, a little too ready to relax this Christmas? Ive been under the weather, not gravely so, but I am going through tissues at a maniacal pace, rewatching The Crown, and then Googling the royal family on my phone. (I believe this is called self-care.)

title: Impeachment Hurts, and Trump Knows It
description: President Trumps almost inevitable acquittal doesnt mean impeachment wasnt worthwhile.

title: Daniel Fishs Post-Oklahoma! Musical: The Most Happy Fella
description: Daniel Fish, the director behind the Tony Award-winning Oklahoma! revival, has a new midcentury musical reinvention project in the works: Frank Loessers acclaimed, quasi-operatic The Most Happy Fella.

title: The Lies the Generals Told About Afghanistan
description: At War is a newsletter about the experiences and costs of war. Sign up here to get it delivered to your inbox every Friday.

title: Vaping Patients May Be Prone to Relapse, C.D.C. Warns
description: Health officials are warning doctors to more closely monitor patients with severe lung damage caused by vaping, because some have relapsed or died shortly after being sent home from the hospital.

title: Debating the Best Albums of 2019
description: Consider the sheer impossibility of absorbing all of the music released in a year. With the advent of streaming services and the minimal friction for musicians to post their work online, there is now more music arriving than ever before. Add to that the increasing fragility of the album as a delivery vehicle, and the task of ranking the best albums of the year can seem more foolish than ever.

title: Vienna Ballet Academy Removes Leaders Power After Abuse Scandal
description: LONDON  The Vienna State Opera on Friday removed all responsibilities from Simona Noja-Nebyla, the managing director of its historic ballet academy. The move came just days after an independent commission said the academy had endangered the well-being of its students.

title: Trump to Give State of the Union Address Feb. 4
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker Nancy Pelosi invited President Trump to give the State of the Union address on Feb. 4, a sign that business is operating as usual in the nations capital, even after the House impeached the president two days ago.

title: Hague Prosecutor Ready to Investigate Israel, if Assured of Jurisdiction
description: JERUSALEM  The chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court said on Friday that she had found a basis for investigating possible war crimes by Israel in the occupied Palestinian territories. But she is first asking the court to confirm that it has jurisdiction there, which Israel insists it does not.

title: A Bar Revered for Its Old-Fashioned Charm and Witty Murals
description: In this series for T, the author Reggie Nadelson revisits New York institutions that have defined cool for decades, from time-honored restaurants to unsung dives.

title: Times Critics Talk About Their Year-End Lists
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music | How to Listen

title: Love Letter: A Subway Crush Remembered
description: [This is the Love Letter newsletter. Sign up here to receive it in your inbox. ]

title: How Pop and Jazz Revisited the Past in 13 Boxed Sets
description: (Bear Family; 10 CDs plus hard-bound book, $179.68)

title: We Respond to the Historians Who Critiqued The 1619 Project
description: The letter below was published in the Dec. 29 issue of The New York Times Magazine. RE: The 1619 ProjectWe write as historians to express our strong reservations about important aspects of The 1619 Project. The project is intended to offer a new version of American history in which slavery and white supremacy become the dominant organizing themes. The Times has announced ambitious plans to make the project available to schools in the form of curriculums and related instructional material.

title: One Carnival Cruise Ship Hits Another, Injuring 6
description: One Carnival cruise ship crashed into another while trying to dock at a port in Mexico on Friday, leaving six injured passengers, a damaged hull and a handful of expletive-laden social media videos in its wake.

title: Robert Moir, 58, Dies; His Research Changed Views on Alzheimers
description: Robert D. Moir, a Harvard scientist whose radical theories of the brain plaques in Alzheimers defied conventional views of the disease, but whose research ultimately led to important proposals for how to treat it, died on Friday at a hospice in Milton, Mass. He was 58.

title: Star Wars Episodes I-IX, as New York Times Critics Saw Them
description: The critics consensus on The Rise of Skywalker, the final installment of Star Wars, is not great. According to Rotten Tomatoes, before the movie opened, it stood at 57 percent fresh.

title: Facebook Discovers Fakes That Show Evolution of Disinformation
description: Facebook said on Friday that it had removed hundreds of accounts with ties to the Epoch Media Group, parent company of the Falun Gong-related publication and conservative news outlet The Epoch Times.

title: Phase 2, an Aerosol Art Innovator, Is Dead at 64
description: Phase 2, who in the early 1970s was one of the most prolific, inventive and emulated New York graffiti writers, and who later produced early hip-hops most innovative fliers, died on Dec. 12 at a nursing and rehabilitation center in the Bronx. He was 64.

title: The Playlist: Taylor Swifts Nostalgic Tune, and 12 More Holiday Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads
description: Welcome to the weekend. Weve had an impeachment (as if you didnt know). Theres been some snow in New York and super hot temperatures in Australia. And theres a big holiday coming up. Are you ready? However you celebrate  and even if you dont  we wish you all the best.

title: U.S. Accuses Venezuelas President of Rigging Coming Vote
description: WASHINGTON  The United States accused President Nicols Maduro of Venezuela on Friday of trying to rig a coming election for control of his countrys parliament, either by detaining opposition leaders or bribing lawmakers with up to $500,000 for each vote.

title: Sutter Health to Pay $575 Million to Settle Antitrust Lawsuit
description: Sutter Health, the large hospital system in Northern California, said Friday that it had agreed to pay $575 million to settle claims of anti-competitive behavior brought by the California state attorney general as well as unions and employers.

title: A Case Study: Heres What Else You Need to Know Today
description: Documenting the evolution of the line on The Daily from 2017 to 2019.

title: Yes, Theres a Diverse Democratic Field
description: To the Editor:

title: Columbia Inquiry Found Plagiarism in Monica Crowleys Dissertation
description: WASHINGTON  Monica Crowley, the Treasury Departments assistant secretary for public affairs, committed localized instances of plagiarism in her 2000 Ph.D. dissertation, Columbia University found in an investigation that ultimately concluded she did not commit research misconduct.

title: We Cant See Star Wars Anymore
description: The release of the latest, and allegedly last, installment in the Skywalker Saga, comprising the canonical triad of trilogies in the eternally expanding Star Wars universe, seems like an appropriate time to pose a wistful little thought experiment: What if Star Wars  the original 1977 film  had performed at the box office about as everyone expected, in the range of a 70s Disney film, earning, say, $16 million? Lets imagine that some film historian or revisionist critic circa 2019 were to rediscover this forgotten gem, an oddity of 70s cinema buried among all the Watergate-paranoia thrillers, demonic horror films and disaster blockbusters. Can we, with 40 years retrospect, evaluate it as a film instead of a phenomenon?

title: Trump Isnt the Only One With Conspiracy Theories
description: President Trumps impeachment is the result of a conspiracy theory. Democrats and other supporters of the charges against Mr. Trump might be reluctant to accept that labeling. But a conspiracy theory is not necessarily crackpot or wrong: If the conspiracy is real, the theory may be correct.

title: Beholding Virginia Woolf Through the Women in Her Life
description: VIRGINIA WOOLFAnd the Women Who Shaped Her WorldBy Gillian Gill

title: Evangelical Leaders Close Ranks With Trump After Scathing Editorial
description: The publication is small, reaching just a fraction of the evangelical movement.

title: Delaying the Next Step in Impeachment
description: To the Editor:

title: You Can Try Miss Americas Science Experiment at Home
description: When she walked onto the stage for the talent portion of the Miss America competition, Camille Schrier wore a simple white lab coat, stood in front of three flasks containing  hydrogen peroxide and joked, Dont try this at home.

title: The Decision to Impeach
description: How do you cover a dramatic, momentous news event whose outcome is well-known beforehand?

title: LeBrons Lakers Are Weary From the Road but Riding High
description: MILWAUKEE  The Los Angeles Lakers were minutes removed from their fifth straight road game on Thursday night when LeBron James was asked about the prospect of heading home to play the Denver Nuggets on Sunday. James processed the question for a split second, then reclined in his folding chair as if he were on a beach towel in Hawaii. He smiled and rubbed his head.

title: Legal Marijuanas Unresolved Issues a Year On
description: Just over a year has passed since Canada became the first large industrialized nation to legalize recreational marijuana. Heres the mini version of the article I wrote for The Times about what it has brought the country: tears for investors, frustration for many shoppers and indifference from most of the public, but few of the widely feared problems. Please let me encourage you to read the full version.

title: The N.F.L.s Embrace of Black Players Has Always Been Conditional
description: The explosion of young black quarterbacks with phenomenal athletic ability and passing acumen has become the rage of the N.F.L. As defenses in the league have become more athletic, offenses have made an adjustment at the sports most important position.

title: Trump Administration Blocks Energy Efficiency Rule for Light Bulbs
description: The Trump administration announced Friday that it would block a rule designed to phase out older incandescent bulbs and require Americans to use energy-efficient light bulbs.

title: The Game Was on TV. The Beer Was on Ice. So Why Were Fans Uneasy?
description: DOHA, Qatar  Finding a way to accommodate soccers free-flowing, alcohol-infused fan culture with the traditions and religious beliefs of an overwhelmingly Muslim country like Qatar remains one of the significant challenges facing the emirate as it prepares to host soccers World Cup in 2022.

title: Yes You Can: Tie a Necktie
description: A well-tied necktie can add a touch of sophistication to your formal-wear. Dont be intimidated by that 58 inch length of fabric. Well show you how to confidently tie your own (no mom required).

title: Drita DAvanzo, Hot-Tempered Star of Mob Wives, Is Arrested
description: The selling point of the VH1 reality show Mob Wives was its authenticity: a group of Staten Island women with mobster husbands and a tough-girl penchant for chardonnay, omert and a hot temper.

title: New Zealand Ban on Most Semiautomatic Weapons Takes Effect
description: A sweeping nationwide ban on most semiautomatic weapons took effect in New Zealand on Saturday, as a monthslong gun buyback and amnesty program ended amid debate over its success.

title: How? How? How?: Victims Families Rage as Matt Bevin Defends Pardons
description: FRANKFORT, Ky.  The mother was at home preparing cheese sticks and a milkshake when she got the call. On the other line, a prosecutor had surprising news about the man who had been convicted of repeatedly sexually assaulting her child and sentenced last year to 23 years in prison.

title: Homelessness Rises 2.7 Percent, Driven by Californias Crisis, Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  Homelessness in the United States continued to rise this year, driven by soaring rates of homelessness in California, according to a new federal report that could prompt long-promised action for people living in the streets of Los Angeles and San Francisco.

title: Alzheimers Tests Soon May Be Common. Should You Get One?
description: Not long ago, the only way to know if someone had Alzheimers disease was to examine the brain in an autopsy.

title: Military Says Hand Gestures at Game Were Not White Power Signs
description: Military officials said on Friday that their investigations had found that Army cadets and Navy midshipmen who flashed hand symbols during a nationally televised football pregame show last week were playing a juvenile game known as the circle game, and not making hand gestures associated with white nationalists and other hate groups.

title: Every Musical Number in Cats, Ranked From Huh? to What???
description: The rumors are true: They have finally made a movie version of Cats, the long-running Andrew Lloyd Webber musical about a surprisingly enthusiastic feline-euthanasia competition. Is it any good?

title: 5 Holiday Dinner Guest Tips No One Taught You
description: If youre going to be a guest at someone elses holiday party this year, a little awareness and volunteering on your part can help the host relax.

title: Why We Published The 1619 Project
description: The project puts the consequences of slavery and the contributions of black Americans at the center of our national story.

title: Democratic Debate Clashes Had a Common Denominator: Iowa
description: DES MOINES  As Elizabeth Warren and Amy Klobuchar escalated their attacks on Pete Buttigieg in Thursday nights Democratic debate, and Mr. Buttigieg forcefully pushed back, a crucial if unspoken fact was driving the political combat: All three candidates are trying to knock each other out in the Iowa caucuses, where they need strong finishes to stay viable in the 2020 race.

title: Starliner, Democratic Party, Holidays: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A Longing for the Lost Landline
description: This is a lament for the landline, a rhapsody for its dial tone, a hymn to the way it connected people. Its the little things we miss. The landline was a focal point of the home, an antidote to atomization and loneliness, those scourges of our age.

title: In Praise of One Womans Love Affair With Fashion
description: When fashion enters the hallowed halls of an art institution, as a rule, it begins to fall victim to museumitis: the need to justify its presence in the temple of high culture by focusing almost entirely on its craft or conception. This is understandable, but the result can often seem a bit arid; clothes, after all, were made for people, and it is people that animate them. To separate the life of a garment from actual life can also sap it of emotion, and meaning.

title: This Decade of Disillusion
description: There are eras in history, like the 1950s, when older people set the cultural and moral terms for the young. And there are eras, like the 1960s, when its the other way around.

title: Treasury Completes Rules for Opportunity Zone Tax Breaks
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration finished regulations this week that will make it easier for wealthy Americans to invest in and benefit from opportunity zones, a tax incentive created in 2017 that was intended to funnel investment into low-income communities.

title: Who Gets to Join a Santa Society? Debate Over Inclusion Divides a Bearded Brotherhood
description: For years, there wasnt much confusion about who could join the International Brotherhood of Real Bearded Santas, the largest membership organization of Santas in the world. It was open only to men with whiskers long enough to be styled like St. Nicks, which could withstand a firm tug from a formidable toddler.

title: Randy Suess, Computer Bulletin Board Inventor, Dies at 74
description: Randy Suess, a computer hobbyist who helped build the first online bulletin board, anticipating the rise of the internet, messaging apps and social media, died on Dec. 10 in Chicago. He was 74.

title: Trump Has a Habit of Quoting His Allies on Twitter Saying Things They Never Said
description: WASHINGTON  Watching Fox News ahead of Wednesdays impeachment vote, President Trump gave a Twitter call out to one of his most combative allies in the House.

title: New Jersey Is Third State to Ban Discrimination Based on Hair
description: One year after a black high school wrestler in New Jersey was forced to cut his dreadlocks to participate in a match, Gov. Phil Murphy signed a law this week making it illegal to discriminate against people based on hairstyles associated with race.

title: Holiday Stress Can Be Unbearable. But You Will Miss It When Its Gone.
description: Anyone desperate enough to Google the term holiday stress will be rewarded (or become more overwhelmed) with about 395,000,000 results. Limit the search to holiday stress statistics 2019 and the results come down to a measly 28,100,000 or so. There are even specific memes and GIFs on how to handle the financial, social and emotional stresses of the season, including my current favorite, the article that ran in this newspaper by a Buddhist teacher who advises practicing acceptance, an activity that even on nonholidays can often seem as challenging as climbing Mount Everest in an ice storm.

title: Surveillance Court Orders Review of Actions by Ex-F.B.I. Lawyer
description: WASHINGTON  A secretive court that oversees national security surveillance has taken a step toward addressing dysfunction in the system detailed in a recent inspector general report, ordering the Justice Department to identify all cases that an F.B.I. lawyer heavily criticized in the report has worked on, according to an order made public on Friday.

title: A Law Professors Provocative Argument: Trump Has Not Yet Been Impeached
description: WASHINGTON  Maybe President Trump has not been impeached after all, or at least not yet.

title: Boy, 14, Sought in Killing of Tessa Majors, Barnard Student
description: [Update: The focus in the Tessa Majors case turned to DNA evidence.]

title: At Yeshiva U., Man Breaks Into Dorm and Sets Fires as Students Sleep
description: The video, recorded shortly before 4 a.m. Friday, shows a man outside a building lobby. He kicks the bottom pane of a glass entry door violently several times, smashing it but not breaking through.

title: Junior Johnson, Good-Old-Boy Auto Racing Star, Is Dead at 88
description: Junior Johnson, a former teenage moonshiner from the North Carolina hills who became one of the greatest drivers in stock-car racing and the personification of its country roots, died on Friday in Charlotte, N.C. He was 88.

title: Administration Threatened Veto Over Ukraine Aid in Spending Package
description: WASHINGTON President Trumps advisers rejected a bid to force his administration to quickly release military assistance for Ukraine early next year, threatening in recent weeks that he would veto must-pass spending legislation if Congress did not remove the directive.

title: Mitch McConnell, Master of the Blockade, Plots Impeachment Strategy
description: WASHINGTON  Shattering convention, he held open a Supreme Court seat for 11 months. He twice changed Senate rules to create a record-setting assembly line of conservative federal judicial confirmations. He has been ruthless in his control of the Senate floor, denying Republicans and Democrats alike much opportunity to debate legislation.

title: Democrats Sparred Over a Wine Cave Fund-Raiser. Its Billionaire Owner Isnt Pleased.
description: RUTHERFORD, Calif.  To reach the wine cave that set off a firestorm in this weeks Democratic presidential debate, visitors must navigate a hillside shrouded in mossy oak trees and walk down a brick-and-limestone hallway lined with wine barrels. Inside the room, a strikingly long table made of wood and onyx sits below a raindrop chandelier with 1,500 Swarovski crystals.

title: Hiring 500 More Police Officers for the Subway Is a Misuse of Funds
description: Subway crime remains at record-low levels.

title: Why Is the Justice Department Treating T-Mobile Like a Client?
description: Makan Delrahim, the head of the Justice Departments antitrust division, is paid by taxpayers to prevent corporate mergers that damage the public interest. Instead of doing this important police work, however, Mr. Delrahim has chosen to cast himself as a deal maker.

title: Georgia Company Recalls Eggs Linked to Deadly Listeria Outbreak
description: A Georgia food company said Friday that it was recalling hard-boiled eggs that were sold in bulk and linked to a listeria outbreak that led to sicknesses in five states, including one death and four hospitalizations.

title: A-O.K.
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Todays strongly geometric grid is from Julian Lim, a constructor who was prolific in The Times in the earlier 2010s. This puzzle has an average word count for a Saturday (68), but the arrangement of entries is really interesting, with the two cutoff corners and the two crosses.

title: 14 Horses Found Shot to Death at Abandoned Coal Mining Site in Kentucky
description: The crime scene  deep in Appalachias coal country  is so desolate that the only way in or out is by all-terrain vehicle. There are no paved roads to speak of.

title: Quotation of the Day: Outrage Erupts as a Governor Issues Pardons
description: You have police, F.B.I., judges, prosecutors, defense attorneys, hours and hours of work undone on the whim of one person. Its almost like a godlike power.

title: Corrections: Dec. 21, 2019
description: An article on Friday about the haggling and eventual agreement between congressional Democrats and the Trump Administration over the new North American trade deal misstated the stance of Representative Terri A. Sewell of Alabama on past trade deals. It is not true that she had never voted on a trade deal. The article also misstated the timing of a conversation Speaker Nancy Pelosis office had with Robert Lighthizer, the countrys top trade negotiator, and when Ms. Pelosi told the Democratic caucus We ate their lunch. Ms. Pelosis office informed Mr. Lighthizer of a news conference late Monday, not Tuesday, and the speaker talked to her caucus on Tuesday, not Wednesday.

title: From All Business to Romance
description: Kristin Maria Cahill and James Ernest Iiguez were married Dec. 21 at the Atelier Ballroom in Jersey City, N.J. Jaimee Lynn Nelson, a Universal Life minister and a friend of the couple, officiated.

title: Their Meeting Was Music to Her Ears
description: Amanda Lori Yesnowitz and Brendan Michael McGrady were married Dec. 16 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Zuleima Astol, a member of the New York City clerks office, officiated.

title: D.H.S. Inspector General Finds No Misconduct by Officials in Deaths of 2 Migrant Children
description: The Department of Homeland Securitys Office of Inspector General said Friday that it had found no misconduct or malfeasance by department officials in the deaths of two Guatemalan children who died in the custody of the United States Border Patrol last year.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: The Kill Team and The Santa Clause
description: THE KILL TEAM (2019) Stream on Amazon; rent on Amazon or Vudu. The director Dan Krauss revisits the case at the center of his 2014 documentary The Kill Team in this war drama. Andrew (Nat Wolff), a young American soldier in Afghanistan, starts his deployment with fortitude. But after he witnesses fellow recruits kill innocent Afghan civilians, he second-guesses his brigades mission and considers reporting their behavior. What stops him, though, is a terrifying sergeant (Alexander Skarsgard) and the possibility that Andrews fellow soldiers would kill him, too. Dramatizing these events makes them seem isolated  a bad-apples incident, Ben Kenigsberg wrote in his New York Times review. The documentary had a more haunting implication: If you train soldiers for Hollywood-ready combat, violence on peacekeeping missions becomes inevitable.

title: Soccer Is Politics, Whether It Likes It or Not
description: Mesut zil is slowly disappearing from China. An online forum dedicated to him has closed. He has been scrubbed from the version of Pro Evolution Soccer, the video game, that is available in the country. Arsenal's last Premier League game, at home to Manchester City, was not broadcast on Chinese television. It is not clear, yet, how long the blackout will last.

title: Polish Government Pushes Legislation to Tighten Control Over Judges
description: WARSAW  Polands right-wing governing party is pressing ahead with sweeping new legislation to tighten controls over judges, despite concerns from European Union officials that it would undermine the independence of the judiciary and the countrys democracy.

title: Iraq in Worst Political Crisis in Years as Death Toll Mounts From Protests
description: BAGHDAD  For 12 weeks, Iraqi protesters have massed in the streets of Baghdad and cities in southern Iraq to demand the ouster of the government, an end to corruption and a halt to the overweening influence of Iran.

title: Nancy Pelosi, Adam Schiff and Michael Bloomberg on the Charity Circuit
description: Benefits were held for Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights, New York Botanical Garden and the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: The Long Tail of Where the Crawdads Sing
description: In the summer of 2018, Putnam published an unusual debut novel by a retired wildlife biologist named Delia Owens. The book, which had an odd title and didnt fit neatly into any genre, hardly seemed destined to be a blockbuster, so Putnam printed about 28,000 copies.

title: Gang Kingpin Accused of Running Murderous Empire From Prison
description: He went to prison for attempted murder and robbery, expecting to spend the rest of his life behind bars.

title: For N.F.L. Mothers, Injury Is at the Forefront of Your Mind
description: As with any great American endeavor, women have been in football from the very beginning. As far back as 1926, women were playing the sport, albeit as halftime entertainment during home games of the Frankford (Pa.) Yellow Jackets. Since then, women have populated bandstands, infiltrated sidelines, officiated games, coached and owned teams in the National Football League, their ranks growing as opportunities and attitudes continue to shift.

title: Vacations: Thats What (Making) Friends Are For
description: Donnajean Pierson bought two souvenirs in Patagonia a few years ago: a scarf and a field guide.

title: A Lighting Designer on Lighting Hotels
description: Brian Orter has always understood the importance of setting the mood and the power of lighting to transform a space or a moment. As a child, he would put colored bulbs into his lamps and read books with a variety of colored lights.

title: Decades Later, His Student Debt Came Back to Haunt Him
description: In the mid-1960s, Edward Durham briefly studied data processing at the Borough of Manhattan Community College. He dropped out after about a year and moved to Atlanta.

title: Empty Hotels and Salmon Stuck in Traffic: Strike Bites French Economy
description: PARIS  Glittering with Christmas decorations, Galeries Lafayette, a famed department store in central Paris, typically draws up to 80,000 visitors a day during the holidays.

title: U.S. Braces for Major North Korean Weapons Test as Trumps Diplomacy Fizzles
description: WASHINGTON  American military and intelligence officials tracking North Koreas actions by the hour say they are bracing for an imminent test of an intercontinental ballistic missile capable of reaching American shores, but appear resigned to the fact that President Trump has no good options to stop it.

title: Trying to Reach the North Pole? Check Your Wi-Fi
description: When Alan Kerrs daughters confessed that they no longer believed in Santa Claus, he shared a confession of his own.

title: Im Kidnapped: A Fathers Nightmare on the Border
description: REYNOSA, Mexico  He remembers being on his knees, gagged and blinded with duct tape, his hands tied behind his back. One of his captors struck his left thigh with a bat and scraped his neck with an ax, threatening to cut him.

title: Impeachment and a Wine Cave Debate: This Week in the 2020 Race
description: It appears nobody consulted the Jedi Council before scheduling a Democratic debate on the same night that Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker opened. So if you missed it, or any of the other happenings on the 2020 campaign trail this week, were here to help.

title: They Built a Homeland Far From Chinas Grip. Now Theyre Afraid.
description: ISTANBUL  Six years ago, he fled Chinas crackdown on Muslim Uighurs and sought refuge in Turkey, joining a community of fellow exiles. He started a business with his brother, translating and publishing self-help books into their language. His wife got a job as a teacher in a Uighur school where his children began to take classes.

title: A Modern-Day Christmas Market, Transylvania-Style
description: In the cobbled old town of Sibiu, an ancient Transylvanian city in the heart of Romania, a small Christmas market is in full swing, with the sweet scent of mulled wine filling the air and a tall spruce, a tiny ice rink and childrens attractions spreading the holiday spirit.

title: These Reporters Lost Their Jobs. Here Are the Stories They Couldnt Tell.
description: They were experts on New Orleans public schools and Oregon state politics. They shared the news when a popular high school basketball player in Colorado returned to the court after a knee injury, and they helped solve the mystery of a City Hall cake vandalism in Texas. At newspapers big and small  for moments grand and modest  these local newspaper journalists told the stories of their communities.

title: What We Learned in Science News in 2019
description: Its not easy to say that any particular space or astronomy development was the most important in a given year. But if we had to choose some highlights, wed opt for these unforgettable events and findings.

title: More Than 1 in 5 U.S. Papers Has Closed. This Is the Result.
description: City Council and school board meetings. Small-town sports and politics. Local government corruption.

title: Kennedys Honor Nancy Pelosi
description: Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights held an awards dinner at the New York Hilton Midtown on Dec. 12. The New York Botanical Garden held a winter ball on Dec. 13. And the Metropolitan Museum of Art celebrated new acquisitions on Dec. 12.

title: Can Recycled Rags Fix Fashions Waste Problem?
description: Tucked away in the bowels of the Brooklyn Army Terminal is a 4,000-square-foot warehouse filled from wall to wall and floor to ceiling with garbage bags. They contain castoffs from New Yorks fashion studios: mock-up pockets ripped from sample jeans, swatches in next seasons paisley print.

title: The Store Where Los Angeles Converges
description: Betty Figueroa, 52, rides the 720 Wilshire rapid bus for more than two hours every morning from her apartment in the Koreatown neighborhood of Los Angeles to her housekeeping job in Brentwood. It takes her another two hours  depending on traffic  to get back to the apartment where she lives with her mother, Deborah Hernndez, 80, and her two daughters each afternoon.

title: I Sent a Reporter to Warroad. We Returned Together for a Whip Around Town.
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Where Even the Children Are Being Tracked
description: We followed every move of people in one city. Then we went to tell them.

title: Podcasts to Keep You Company While Running
description: Welcome to the Running newsletter! Every Saturday morning, we email runners with news, advice and some motivation to help you get up and running. Sign up here to get it in your inbox.

title: How to Get Ahead of Proposal Anxiety
description: The holidays are here, and so is the season for marriage proposals.

title: 2019 N.F.L. Playoff Picture: Mapping the Paths That Remain for Each Team
description: Visualizing the possible outcomes with two weeks to go.

title: How to Have a Party Without Enraging Your Neighbors
description: Q: Last year, I had a New Years Eve party and my downstairs neighbors called the police. The party wasnt wild, just 20 friends dancing and talking until pretty late. I dont normally have loud parties, but it was New Years Eve! I want to have another one this year, but Im worried my neighbor will call the police again. What can I do to appease them so the night goes better this year?

title: Our 10 Most Popular Recipes Right Now
description: The top dishes include many ideal for feeding a crowded house, like cheesy, spicy black bean bake (above), an English muffin breakfast casserole and Melissa Clarks new Feast of the Seven Fishes pie. Click the 10 Most Popular Recipes collection below for more recipes.

title: How to Remember the Alamo: Battle Site or Burial Ground?
description: The remains of three people were uncovered during excavation work at the Alamo in San Antonio, and the discovery has reignited longstanding disputes over how to tell the full history of one of the most fabled battle sites in the United States.

title: Woman Ran Over Girl Because She Was a Mexican, Police Say
description: An Iowa woman was charged with attempted murder after running over a 14-year-old girl because she thought the teenager was Mexican, the police said.

title: When It Seemed Like Communism Would Take Over the World
description: On Dec. 21, 1919, this newspaper reported that Bolshevik forces in Russia had won a sweeping victory along the Estonian border, capturing 2,500 prisoners in a campaign to solidify their northwestern border. For a moment, their future seemed bright. The month before in Petrograd, about 100 miles to the northeast, the Bolsheviks had celebrated the second anniversary of the Soviet revolution with lengthy processions with red banners and brass bands. Grigory Zinoviev, chairman of the Petrograd Soviet, had stood on a podium in the cold fall air, with factory workers, soldiers and sailors from the Baltic fleet arrayed below him, to report on the regimes accomplishments for the last two years and its prospects for the immediate future.

title: Harry Potter Helped Me Come Out as Trans, But J.K. Rowling Disappointed Me
description: On Thursday, J.K. Rowling caused an uproar when she tweeted her support of Maya Forstater, a British researcher.

title: Is the Big Shake-Up in Britain Coming to the U.S.?
description: Britain has been rocked by eight major electoral contests in the last nine years. Four general elections, two referendums on Scotlands independence and European Union membership and two sets of European Parliament elections have pushed one of the worlds oldest and historically most stable democracies into a period of churn and change.

title: In India Tech City Shocked by Gang Rape, Vigilante Justice Gets Praise
description: HYDERABAD, India All day, every day, at a certain point along a highway leading out of Hyderabad, people stop their cars and get out to peer over the guardrail.

title: U.K. Security Service Can Let Informants Commit Crimes, Court Rules
description: LONDON  A British court has upheld a government policy that allows informants of the British domestic intelligence service to commit crimes when it is deemed to be in the interest of national security, in a case that judges said exposed a tension between the rule of law and public safety.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: ACROSTIC   Leave it to our faithful acrosticeers to present us with a perfect chestnut. This classic passage wasnt too tricky to tease out, I hope, and I hope that whatever mood youre in this weekend is reinforced or improved by the solve. If this guy can come around, well, thats all Im saying about that.

title: Why Education Reforms Arent Working
description: To the Editor:

title: Fear and Loyalty: How Donald Trump Took Over the Republican Party
description: BIRMINGHAM, Mich.  By the summer of 2017, Dave Trott, a two-term Republican congressman, was worried enough about President Trumps erratic behavior and his flailing attempts to repeal the Affordable Care Act that he criticized the president in a closed-door meeting with fellow G.O.P. lawmakers.

title: Trump Backs Down From Threat to Place Tariffs on Brazilian Steel
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has backed off a threat he made this month to impose tariffs on Brazilian metal, a move that would have broken a previous agreement with the country and risked reigniting trade tensions.

title: Colleges Agree to Allow Increased Competition for Applicants
description: WASHINGTON  The financial aid stranglehold on students who commit to colleges may be broken.

title: Star Wars Box Office on Pace for $400 Million Opening Weekend
description: LOS ANGELES  I find your lack of faith disturbing.

title: Is Anyone Happy Anymore?
description: Recently I have been forced to think a bit about happiness. Its not something Ive done before. I have been too busy living. But when an interview with me appeared in The Sunday Times under the headline Why This Is Happiness Author Niall Williams Is Happily Out of Step, I began to realize that it was not just me but the idea of happiness itself that was out of step with the times, and that it required some mental adjusting, not to say daring, to say aloud the title of my novel.

title: Was the Virgin Mary a Virgin? Does It Matter?
description: Welcome to the latest in my occasional series of conversations about Christianity. Heres my interview, edited for space, with Philip Yancey, an evangelical Christian writer who has more than 15 million books in print in more than 50 languages.

title: Short-Term Thinking Is Poisoning American Business
description: In 2007, James Rogers did the unthinkable. As chief executive of Duke Energy, one of the largest coal-powered utilities in the country, he lobbied for the passage of aggressive cap-and-trade legislation. The bill, if passed, would have imposed billions of dollars in costs on his business, and it was vigorously opposed by the coal industrys primary lobbyist.

title: The World Christmas Made
description: In early November, a study published in the journal Science claimed to trace the whole social course of modernity  the decline of clan and tribe, the turn to nuclear families, the rise of individualism  back to Roman Catholicisms opposition to incest.

title: Chinas New Civil Religion
description: BEIJING  In the northern suburbs of this city is a small temple to a Chinese folk deity, Lord Guan, a famous warrior deified more than a millennium ago. Renovated five years ago at the governments expense, the temple is used by a group of retirees who run pilgrimages to a holy mountain, schoolchildren who come to learn traditional culture and a Taoist priest who preaches to wealthy urbanites about the traditional values of ancient China.

title: Las Vegas Apartment Fire Kills at Least 6, Officials Say
description: Authorities said they were investigating whether a stove that was being used for heat ignited an early-morning fire in a Las Vegas apartment building on Saturday, killing six people and injuring 13 in the deadliest blaze in the citys history.

title: How to Turn Anger and Fear Into Political Power
description: PHOENIX  First there were seven. Then 50. Then thousands of people, mostly Latino and many undocumented, who held a vigil on the lawn outside of the Arizona State Capitol in the spring of 2010, praying that Gov. Jan Brewer would not sign an anti-immigrant bill, the most punitive in generations, which had sailed through the Republican-controlled Legislature.

title: What Happened to All Those Frozen Eggs?
description: The potential for egg freezing to allow women to pause their biological clocks is one of the most astonishing developments of recent fertility science. The promise was thrilling: Women could enjoy more time to find the right partners, break up with the wrong ones and become emotionally and financially ready to become mothers.

title: The Poverty and Prosperity of Losing My Husband
description: Last week I got new checks in the mail. It had been years since I needed any; like most people I find myself writing fewer and fewer checks these days. Cutting open the package, I was struck by the fact that where I used to receive a whole box of checks, I now got a slim envelope with only two books  one more paper item that used to be solid and institutional was now, like so much else, swiftly passing into irrelevance. I couldnt help feeling a twinge of loss.

title: How Trump Made a Writer of Thrillers Stick to Facts
description: WEST TISBURY, Mass.  Over four decades and nearly two dozen thrillers, the novelist Richard North Patterson has used current events as scaffolding for his imagination. Late-stage abortion, conflict in the Middle East, genocide in Africa, gun control, the death penalty  the thornier the issue, the better.

title: Whats Wrong With Manchester City? Nothing
description: MANCHESTER, England  It has reached the stage, now, when it comes to gauging Pep Guardiolas mood, his state of mind, where no detail can be overlooked.

title: Abbey Simon, Masterly Pianist, Dies at 99
description: AbbeySimon, an American pianist celebrated for a style that harked back to an earlier, golden age of keyboard prowess, died on Wednesday at his home inGeneva. He was99.

title: Down for the Count
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Sunday constructor debuts are great. Not to detract from weekly constructor debuts, which are also wonderful, but a big grid makes a big splash and enables someone to dramatically unfurl those newly fledged wings (newly fledged to us, anyway). According to Will Shortzs print intro, Laura Taylor Kinnel teaches math (surprise!) and is the director of studies at a Friends boarding school in Pennsylvania. Ms. Kinnel traces her interest in crosswords to this venue, solving the Sunday puzzle in The Times with her grandmother.

title: Brendan Dassey of Making a Murderer Is Denied Clemency
description: Gov. Tony Evers of Wisconsin this week denied a request to grant clemency to Brendan Dassey whose murder conviction was documented in the Netflix documentary series Making a Murderer.

title: Matt Bevin Drew Outrage Over His Pardons. These Governors Have, Too.
description: When a radio host asked Matt Bevin, the former governor of Kentucky, why he had pardoned a man convicted of raping a child, Mr. Bevins first response was, Which one?

title: Trump Largely Ignores Impeachment as He Rallies Young Conservatives
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  President Trump on Saturday largely ignored that he had become the third impeached president in history as he rallied young conservative activists with campaign-style attacks on the far-left ruling class at the start of a two-week vacation.

title: Officials Discussed Hold on Ukraine Aid After Trump Spoke With Countrys Leader
description: WASHINGTON  About 90 minutes after President Trump held a controversial telephone call with President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine in July, the White House budget office ordered the Pentagon to suspend all military aid that Congress had allocated to Ukraine, according to emails released by the Pentagon late Friday.

title: Total Surveillance Is Not What America Signed Up For
description: Congress should take bold action to regulate the location data industry.

title: How Your Phone Betrays Democracy
description: You protest, they watch.

title: West African Countries Take a Step Away From Colonial-Era Currency
description: DAKAR, Senegal  A bloc of West African states took a step away from a French-backed regional currency that dates back to the colonial era, making a significant symbolic break from the past.

title: The Patriots Beat the Bills (Again) Behind Julian Edelman
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  An instant after a violent collision on Saturday evening in the pivotal, hard-fought game between New England and Buffalo, Patriots wide receiver Julian Edelman lay motionless on the turf as if unconscious. It was, Edelman said hours later, a ruse. When he slammed into Bills defensive back Jordan Poyer while running a crossing route early in the third quarter, he had committed offensive pass interference  and Edelman knew it.

title: Diane Hu, Alexander Sappington
description: Diane Shuyan Hu and Alexander Joseph William Sappington were married Dec. 20 at Villa Serenita, a rental home in St. Thomas, in the United States Virgin Islands. Michael Motylinski, who received an online ordination through the Wanderlust Bay Ministries, officiated.

title: Meredith Miller, Kimberly Duva
description: Kimberly Ann Duva and Meredith Reade Miller were married Dec. 16 at their apartment in Manhattan. Hilary Gingold, a civil court judge with chambers in Brooklyn, officiated.

title: Boeing Starliner Lands in New Mexico After Clock Error Prompts Early Return
description: Boeings new spacecraft, the CST-100 Starliner, safely parachuted to Earth on Sunday, landing atop inflated airbags before dawn at the White Sands Missile Range in New Mexico.

title: For Women in Kabul, It Is Just Me and the Water
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  When Fatema Saeedi is in the pool, she cannot hear the crowded, chaotic noise of the city around her. She does not think about suicide bombings or Taliban attacks. She concentrates on her breathing as she moves through the water. One hand in front of the other. Exhale.

title: In France, Holiday Skating Rinks Are an Unlikely Climate Battleground
description: ST.-MALO, France  On a recent morning, toddlers and teenagers laughed and shouted as they skated around a rink of shiny ice just outside the walls of St.-Malo, a city on the northern coast of Brittany where winters generally hover above freezing.

title: How a Poisoning in Bulgaria Exposed Russian Assassins in Europe
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  The Russian assassin used an alias, Sergei Fedotov, and slipped into Bulgaria unnoticed, checking into a hotel in Sofia near the office of a local arms manufacturer who had been selling ammunition to Ukraine.

title: Deborah Gist, Ronnie Jobe
description: Deborah Anne Gist and Ronnie Dale Jobe are to be married Dec. 22 at their home in Tulsa, Okla. The Rev. Courtney Richards, a Disciples of Christ minister, is to officiate, with the Rev. Mark R. Wood, an Episcopal priest, to take part.

title: Samantha Meyer, Edward McGarrigle
description: Samantha Hindel Meyer and Edward John McGarrigle were married Dec. 21 at Maritime Parc, an events space in Jersey City, N.J. Brian Pramberger, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, led a ceremony incorporating Jewish traditions.

title: Quotation of the Day: Republican Party Under Trump Offers 2 Options: All In, or Out
description: He has a complete connection with the average Republican voter and thats given him political power here. Trump has touched the nerve of my conservative base like no person in my lifetime.

title: Corrections: Dec. 22, 2019
description: The Ask Watching column last Sunday misstated the location where the television show Claws is set. It is in Manatee County, Fla., not Miami. The error was repeated in a picture caption.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Mr. Robot and Noelle
description: MR. ROBOT 9 p.m. on USA Network. This month, Rami Malek earned his third Golden Globe nomination for his lead role as the tortured vigilante hacker in this cyberthriller series. Elliot (Malek) and Mr. Robot (Christian Slater) have come a long way. In last weeks episode (spoiler alert!), Elliot and Whiterose (BD Wong) shared their vision for humanity in a tense philosophical debate before the creation of a seemingly parallel universe. And, if that werent enough of a cliffhanger, Elliot came face to face with his hooded doppelgnger and asked the burning question: Who are you? Catch the reveal in this two-part series finale.

title: Afghan President Leads in Disputed Vote as Opposition Protests
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  President Ashraf Ghani of Afghanistan was on course to win a second five-year term, the countrys election commission announced Sunday, based on long-delayed preliminary results of the September vote, which has faced protests and accusations of fraud.

title: Ursids Meteor Shower 2019: Watch It Peak in Night Skies
description: All year long as Earth revolves around the sun, it passes through streams of cosmic debris. The resulting meteor showers can light up night skies from dusk to dawn, and if youre lucky you might be able to catch a glimpse.

description: It took 35 years, but Eddie Murphy came back to host Saturday Night Live.

title: U.K. Honors a Flawed Feminist Trailblazer, Nancy Astor
description: PLYMOUTH, England  When women finally won the right in 1918 to enter Britains Parliament, many expected the first female lawmaker to sit there to come from the ranks of the suffragists, the activists who had fought, often at huge personal cost, for the vote.

description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: A Holocaust Survivor Now Struggling to Pay Rent
description: Zoltan Matyash grew up in Czechoslovakia, the oldest of two boys and four girls. He was born a Kohen, part of a line of priests who in the Jewish tradition are responsible for transmitting Gods blessing.

title: Lights. Camera. Senior Center?
description: CULVER CITY, Calif.  A speeding Ford Fiesta passed the Sony Pictures gate and swerved into a parking lot across the street. It was 1:07 p.m. Was this finally him?

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1 Million
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: At Boeing, C.E.O.s Stumbles Deepen a Crisis
#MeToo Clashes With Bro Culture at Ad Agencies
description: The empowerment of women was a major theme of Advertising Week, a yearly gathering of roughly 100,000 ad-industry people in New York. The female R&B group TLC kicked off the program with a concert called Future Is Female, and there were panel discussions with titles like Mom Bosses, #RewriteHerStory and Times Up, Pay Up: We Will Not Wait 100 Years.

title: What We Learned in Space and Astronomy News in 2019
description: Its not easy to say that any particular space or astronomy development was the most important in a given year. But if we had to choose some highlights, wed opt for these unforgettable events and findings.

title: Modi Defends Indian Citizenship Law Amid Violent Protests
description: NEW DELHI  Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India delivered on Sunday a strident defense of a contentious citizenship law that has fueled deadly protests, accusing opposition politicians of spreading lies and demonstrators of trying to destroy the country through vandalism and bloodshed.

title: The Week in Business: Hip, Hip Hooray for Your 401(k)
description: Hey, it looks like the government wont shut down this year! Lets count our economys blessings. Next week will be a pretty slow one for business and tech (aside from the post-holiday shopping frenzy, of course), but 2020 promises all kinds of surprises. Enjoy the calm while it lasts, and happy holidays.

title: Do You Know Where to Find These Gargoyles?
description: This weeks Local Treasure quiz focuses on amusing gargoyles that are fashioned like people and can be found across Manhattan.

title: Another Benefit to Going to Museums? You May Live Longer
description: Numerous studies have shown that art and music can help soothe chronic pain, stave off symptoms of dementia and Alzheimers disease and accelerate brain development in young children.

title: Fighting the Good Fight Against Online Child Sexual Abuse
description: Several websites popular with sexual predators were thwarted last month after a determined campaign by groups dedicated to eliminating the content. It was a rare victory in an unending war.

title: Chicago House Party Shooting Leaves 13 Wounded, 4 Critically, Police Say
description: A house party on the South Side of Chicago was meant to remember a man who was fatally shot during a carjacking in April, the authorities said. But the memorial itself erupted into violence early Sunday after at least two gunmen opened fire, wounding 13 people, four of them critically.

title: The Week in Tech: How Is Antitrust Enforcement Changing?
description: Each week, we review the weeks news, offering analysis about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Its been a difficult month for my crowd, and it looked for a time as if wed lose Christmas entirely. But the trees now trimmed with favorite ornaments (A ski-jumping bear from Quebec! A ceramic dolphin from Florida!), and the whole place smells of forest and cinnamon. Theres lots of jing-jing-jingling. The dogs asleep in front of the fire.

title: What You Get for $2 Million in California
description: A 1988 clapboard-and-stone house in Sonora, A recently built townhouse in La Jolla and a newly renovated ranch house in Sebastopol.

title: How to Give Kids Gifts With Real Value
description: When my 9-year-old daughter asked for a sewing machine last year, my instinct was to pick up a simple one for kids. It was inexpensive. It was easy. I could check it off my list and be done. But a good friend steered me away.

title: No Magic Bullets in the Fight Against Online Abuse, but Spiders Help
description: Sexual predators have grown increasingly adept at using the internet to share and view child sexual abuse photos and videos. Some have computer-programming skills and have deployed sophisticated defenses against efforts to take them down.

description: Michael R. Bloomberg was not entirely picky.

title: What Youre Unwrapping When You Get a DNA Test for Christmas
description: The company GEDmatch, the DNA database that facilitated an arrest in the Golden State Killer case and in dozens of other cases since, emerged from a desire to connect people to their relatives. For the past decade, the sites co-founder Curtis Rogers has been running the company out of a small yellow house in Lake Worth, Fla.

title: Nigeria Cracks Down on a Critic, and a New Jersey Town Pushes Back
description: HAWORTH, N.J.  Opeyemi Sowore watched the videos on her phone in bed in her New Jersey home, the children still asleep, the Christmas tree twinkling downstairs.

title: Claudine Auger, James Bonds First French Co-Star, Dies at 78
description: Claudine Auger, Sean Connerys co-star in Thunderball and the first French actress to play James Bonds love interest, died on Wednesday in Paris. She was 78.

title: Mama Cax, Amputee Model and Disability Activist, Dies at 30
description: Mama Cax, a Brooklyn-born advocate for people with disabilities and a rising model who challenged the fashion industrys standard of beauty by not shying away from displaying her prosthetic leg on the runway and in fashion campaigns, died on Dec. 16 in London. She was 30.

title: Jeanne Guillemin, Who Exposed Soviet Anthrax Lab, Dies at 76
description: Jeanne Guillemin, an eminent medical anthropologist and scientific sleuth who helped expose a secret biological warfare lab in the Soviet Union as the source of a lethal anthrax outbreak, died on Nov. 15 at her home in Cambridge, Mass. She was 76.

title: Vaping on Campus: No Parents, No Principals, a Big Problem
description: ATHENS, Ga.  Gail Moody had her first e-cigarette inhale of the day moments after waking up one recent morning. She took more puffs while showering. Aerosolized nicotine filled her lungs again during a break in her morning run, between mouthfuls of lunch, and as she worked at a tobacco shop near the University of Georgia, where she is a sophomore.

title: 9 Delightful Tips for Living a Smarter Life in 2020
description: Welcome to the Smarter Living newsletter! Every Monday, S.L. editor Tim Herrera emails readers with tips and advice for living a better, more fulfilling life. Sign up here to get it in your inbox.

title: Stranded on Border, This Migrant Became the Camp Doctor
description: MATAMOROS, Mexico  Under a canopy on the edge of a squalid encampment, a young physician named Dairon Elisondo Rojas holds office hours every day from 10 to 4.

title: 69-Vehicle Pileup on Virginia Highway Injures 51, Police Say
description: A pileup involving nearly 70 vehicles on an icy and foggy Virginia highway on Sunday morning left at least 51 people hurt, the police said.

title: Cats: Did You See the Movie? Lets Talk
description: Did they freak you out?

title: Dabangg 3 Review: A Hero From the School of Knock em Hard
description: The Bollywood movie Dabangg 3 opens with several bangs: Wedding robbers are doing what wedding robbers do  collecting guests gold chunks and cash  when the police arrive on the scene. The officers bumble until their leader, our hero, Inspector Chulbul Pandey, blasts his way onto the scene. He comes flying through a wall, riding what looks to be a giant drill (or is it a modest rocket?) and proceeds to punch, karate chop, kick, toss in the air, and generally drub the miscreants in a way that would be purely cartoonish if not for a dose of mild sadism. (Crotch, meet knife.)

title: Severe Weather Across Europe Leaves at Least 9 Dead
description: VIGO, Spain  A one-two punch of winter storms has socked Europe with strong winds and rain over several days, leaving at least nine people dead.

title: Review: Sweet Bear, Sticky Situation in Paddington Gets in a Jam
description: Although Winnie-the-Pooh is arguably the most famous bear in childrens fiction, Paddington ranks high in the pantheon.

title: It Seemed Like a Popular Chat App. Its Secretly a Spy Tool.
description: WASHINGTON  It is billed as an easy and secure way to chat by video or text message with friends and family, even in a country that has restricted popular messaging services like WhatsApp and Skype.

title: Not Even Star Wars Can Save This Years Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  Cue the sad trombone: Movie ticket sales in the United States and Canada will total roughly $11.45 billion for the year, a 4 percent decrease from 2018.

title: India Protests, Russian Assassins, ToTok Spying: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Sudan to Investigate Darfur Atrocities Under Ousted Leader
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Sudan has kick-started investigations into the long, bloody suppression of the Darfur region under the government of President Omar Hassan al-Bashir, a move aimed at ending years of impunity and bringing perpetrators to justice amid a fragile political transition.

title: Johanna Lindsey, Best-Selling Romance Novelist, Dies at 67
description: Johanna Lindsey, whose best-selling romance novels told stories of unbridled passion, revenge, submission and abductions among aristocrats, debutantes, pirates and fearless heroines, died on Oct. 27 in Nashua, N.H., her family recently announced. She was 67.

title: Transformed by Mexico, Six Women Broke Barriers Between Art and Design
description: CHICAGO  They lived or worked in Mexico from the 1930s through the 1970s. Some were friends, some mentors, some colleagues. But all of their work, ranging from photography to furniture to weaving to sculpture, was transformed by their time there.

title: No Longer Slumbering
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Were in the throes of the holiday season, which I hope youre all enjoying. It is a good time of the year for themes; I figure that constructors come up with festive seasonal ideas all year round that have to be jiggled in a pocket for months, sometimes, until theyre relevant.

title: Hanukkah in Jersey City After Terror Attack: Good Will Always Win
description: JERSEY CITY  JC Kosher Supermarket no longer has broken windows and strips of yellow police tape.

title: A Jungle Airstrip Stirs Suspicions About Chinas Plans for Cambodia
description: DARA SAKOR, Cambodia  The airstrip stretches like a scar through what was once unspoiled Cambodian jungle.

title: Breaking Ranks, a Rival Takes on Israels Netanyahu From Within
description: OR YEHUDA, Israel  With Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel politically weakened and steeped in legal troubles, a rival from within his conservative Likud party has emerged to challenge his grip on the party leadership.

title: 6 Pedestrians in 3 Days: A Deadly Spate of Crashes in N.Y.C.
description: It was a deadly 72 hours: One woman was killed by a truck that backed up into her; another person was struck by a private sanitation truck; a third was hit by three vehicles at once. Three other victims were over 65.

title: That Christianity Today Editorial Wont Change Anything
description: Thursday night, Christianity Today, long known as the flagship magazine of American evangelicalism, broke the internet with an editorial arguing for the impeachment and removal of Donald Trump from office. The piece, penned by the magazines outgoing editor, Mark Galli, implored evangelicals to consider the unambiguous facts of the impeachment case against the president, maintaining his actions not only violated the Constitution, but were also profoundly immoral.

title: How Centrist Bias Hurts Sanders and Warren
description: John F. Harris is about as mainstream as the mainstream media gets. He spent 21 years at The Washington Post, including as its political editor. Then he became the founding editor of Politico, where he is now a columnist.

title: When the Monkey Chants Are for You: A Soccer Stars View of Racist Abuse
description: MILAN  Romelu Lukaku was planning on a relaxing evening in front of the TV. He might now find himself playing in Italy, but he was looking forward to following the fortunes of two of his former teams in the Premier League.

title: Make Laws, Not Money
description: The case of Chris Collins, the New York Republican who resigned from Congress and pleaded guilty to insider trading earlier this fall, was a rare victory in the long-running battle to ensure that members of Congress do not take improper advantage of their privileged positions.

title: In Hong Kong, a Vast Citizens Network Keeps Watch on the Police
description: As protests and arrests have become routine in the city, online groups have formed to document arrests and police action during protests and at other times.

title: Remembering the Poor on Christmas
description: In the weeks leading up to Christmas in 1975, my mother made a hard choice: Her marriage was dead and it was time to leave it.

title: Black, Homeless and Burdened by L.A.s Legacy of Racism
description: Black people are dramatically overrepresented among those living on Los Angeless streets, where the bright future promised to earlier generations has been blunted by the bitter inheritance of racism.

title: Democrats, Citing White House Emails, Renew Calls for Impeachment Witnesses
description: Top Democrats on Sunday renewed their demands for witnesses to testify at President Trumps impeachment trial, citing newly released emails showing that the White House asked officials to keep quiet over the suspension of military aid to Ukraine just 90 minutes after Mr. Trump leaned on that countrys president to investigate former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: Eagles Finish Off Cowboys, in More Ways Than One
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Dallas Cowboys like to call themselves Americas Team, but these days they could also star on an episode of The Apprentice, with Coach Jason Garrett trying to convince the team owner Jerry Jones that he deserves to keep his job.

title: Green Liquid Oozes Onto a Michigan Highway, Prompting Questions and a Cleanup
description: A peculiar sight greeted motorists on a busy freeway outside Detroit on Friday: a bright green liquid oozing from a retaining wall on Interstate 696.

title: No Corrections: Dec. 23, 2019
description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, Dec. 23, 2019.

title: Quotation of the Day: With No Principals or Parents, Vaping Surges on Campus
description: Its not what its doing to your lungs. Its what its doing to your head. Thats the most difficult thing to quit.

title: American Special Forces Soldier Is Killed in Afghanistan
description: WASHINGTON  An American Special Forces soldier was killed in Afghanistan on Monday, according to military officials, bringing to 20 the number of troops who have died during combat operations this year.

title: What We Learned in N.F.L. Week 16
description: It was hard for Sunday to live up to Saturdays thrilling action, but another huge Baltimore victory, an enormous upset in Seattle, multiple games that went to overtime, a change at the top of the N.F.C. East standings, and a major receiving record being broken gave the second day of Week 16 a massive impact.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: North Korea has promised a Christmas gift to the United States if no progress is made on lifting sanctions. That may be shorthand for a test of an intercontinental ballistic missile  and it could produce a particularly dire cycle of crisis.

title: Whats on TV Monday: His Dark Materials and a Football Finale
description: GREEN BAY PACKERS VS. MINNESOTA VIKINGS 8:15 p.m. on ESPN. The two teams at the top of the N.F.C. North meet in Minneapolis in the final Monday Night Football game of the year. The Minnesota Vikings havent lost at home all season and have never lost to the Packers at U.S. Bank Stadium but they trail their regional rivals in the standings. They were also defeated in an earlier matchup at Lambeau Field in September. With the regular season just two games away from completion theres still plenty to fight for. The Vikings have yet to clinch a playoff spot and the Packers are competing for postseason privileges. Minnesota fans may be hoping that the Vikingss offensive edge and passionate home support will be enough to avoid a regular season series sweep.

title: A Test for Foreign Teachers in Indonesia: Are You Gay?
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Agree or disagree, the exam asked: I would feel uncomfortable knowing my daughters or sons teacher was homosexual.

title: Mr. Robot Series Finale Recap: The Real Thing
description: Lets talk about what the series finale of Mr. Robot isnt.

title: After Truce With U.S., China Cuts Tariffs on Many Global Imports
description: BEIJING  China said on Monday that it will lower tariffs on a variety of goods imported from around the world starting on Jan. 1, moving to support domestic consumers even as a trade truce with the United States has relieved some of the pressure on the Chinese economy.

title: Late Night in 2019: Trump, Trump and More Trump
description: I dont want to talk about Donald Trump every night. None of us do. But he gives us no choice.

title: Durham Surprises Even Allies With Statement on F.B.I.s Trump Case
description: WASHINGTON  Whether investigating charges of torture by the C.I.A., rolling up an organized crime network or prosecuting crooked government officials, John H. Durham, the veteran federal prosecutor named by Attorney General William P. Barr to investigate the origins of the Russia inquiry, burnished his reputation for impartiality over the years by keeping his mouth closed about his work.

title: Japan Wants to Dump Nuclear Plants Tainted Water. Fishermen Fear the Worst.
description: IWAKI, Japan  The overpowering earthquake and tsunami that ripped through northern Japan in March 2011 took so much from Tatsuo Niitsuma, a commercial fisherman in this coastal city in Fukushima Prefecture.

title: Baba Ram Dass, Proponent of LSD Turned New Age Guru, Dies at 88
description: Baba Ram Dass, who epitomized the 1960s of legend by popularizing psychedelic drugs with Timothy Leary, a fellow Harvard academic, before finding spiritual inspiration in India, died on Sunday at his home on Maui, Hawaii. He was 88.

title: Inside Christmas Card, Girl Finds Plea From Chinese Prison Laborers
description: A 6-year-old girl in London preparing Christmas cards for her classmates found a message said to be from prisoners forced into labor in China, prompting the Tesco grocery chain to suspend ties with a supplier.

title: An Insightful New Translation of the Timeless Art of War
